dialogues.speaker: LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: The procession of ape warriors heads through the woods, l by Caesar on horseback. The able march with the injured, helping them keep up; the dead are carried on the backs o horses. A LOW ROAR builds as we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: AN IMPOSING WATERFALL
dialogues.text: RUSHING down sheer rock-face in an area nestled deep in t woods. The apes have stopped to gather along the river at the base of the falls. Shrouded ape bodies are released i the river. Caesar and Maurice sit side by side, apart fro the others -- Caesar, troubled:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't I see, Maurice? Maurice turns to Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [See what?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Koba could not forgive what humans did to him when he was their prisoner. That he would seek revenge. I should have known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No one could have known how much darkness was living inside of him.] A SUDDEN HIGH-PITCHED ALERT rings out, almost like a bugl They quickly look up to --

dialogues.speaker: THE TREELINE ABOVE
dialogues.text: where we discover they are far from alone, the trees comi to life as APES EMERGE EVERYWHERE! Hundreds concealed in CAMOUFLAGED GUARD STRUCTURES in trees and all around the falls. A LONE APE blows into a RAM'S HORN, as others communicate to the apes below that someone is coming...! The apes on the ground seize their weapons, standing at t ready, tension building to a fever-pitch when -- A SMALL GROUP OF HORSES appears through the trees... Caesar's intense expression suddenly changes, swelling wi emotion as he sees -- BLUE EYES, ROCKET, and TWO OTHER APES arriving. They look weary, caked with dust, their horses laden with enough ge to suggest they've been on a long journey. As they dismount, Caesar and a group of others move quick to greet them. Caesar stands before Blue Eyes, the two of them just looking at each other, overcome. Everyone watch giving them their space, when finally Blue Eyes signs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Hello, Father...] A huge smile spreads across Caesar's face and he embraces son. The crowd celebrates, rushing in to join the reunion Caesar turns to Rocket, the two happy to see each other -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, Rocket. (grins at Rocket) You look tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [It was a long journey --]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts in, excited) [Father, we found something!] Caesar looks at him, immediately hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come inside! They all start toward the waterfall -- as we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK SIDE OF THE WATERFALL
dialogues.text: DAYLIGHT plays through the ENORMOUS WALL OF RUSHING WATER the SILHOUETTES of Caesar and the apes appear in front of entering around the edge of the falls. They continue into the cavernous recess as we CUT TO REVEAL we are inside --

dialogues.speaker: A HIDDEN FORTRESS
dialogues.text: Like a primitive castle built into the caves, completely concealed behind the waterfall and surrounding rocks. A FLOOD OF CHILDREN converge around them as their MOTHERS r after them, trying to maintain a little order. Blue Eyes looks through the crowd, spots CORNELIA rushing toward him, beaming -- he beams back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Mother...!] -- she pulls him into an emotional hug. They both look do noticing a TODDLER (CORNELIUS) hiding shyly behind her le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Cornelius, don't you recognize your brother?] Blue Eyes crouches down, strokes his head.   Cornelia gri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Someone else missed you too...] Blue Eyes turns, rising to see -- A YOUNG, FEMALE APE aro Blue Eyes' age (LAKE) standing right behind him. Blue Eye is struck at the very sight of her. She smiles uncertainl as he takes her hands, and they tenderly press their foreheads together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAESAR'S SYMBOL carved into the stone floor; around the symbol sit Caesar and Cornelia, Blue Eyes, Lake, Rocket, Maurice, Luca, Winter and other COUNCIL MEMBERS. A MAP is laid out on the floor; Cornelius presses his fac close, watching Blue Eyes' finger as it points to one spo particular:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passionately, to Caesar) [This is it, Father. We can start over. A new home.]

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cornelia scoops Cornelius into her lap, gently pulling hi away from the map -- she looks at Blue Eyes, intrigued, points:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What is beyond those mountains, son?] Blue Eyes picks up a pouch beside him and digs his hand i removing a fistful of SAND; he spills it out dramatically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [A desert, Rocket and I had to cross it too. The journey is long, but that is why humans will not find us.] Cornelia smiles, nodding -- she and Caesar exchange a pro look -- when Winter cuts in anxiously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We must leave tonight!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Tonight?    That's impossible!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [How much longer can we wait?      Soldiers are getting closer!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching Winter's arm) [Winter...] Winter shrugs him off -- Luca and the others all erupt angrily at Winter -- Caesar stands imposingly. Winter immediately lowers his head, afraid; then, to Caesar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Your son's been gone, he doesn't know how hard it's been!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I know you are scared, we all are, but we are still planning...]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... We must still find a way to get out of the woods safely. Everyone looks at Caesar as he sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were two of you. But we are many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concurring) [The woods are filled with soldiers.] Everyone falls silent.   Blue Eyes meets Caesar's gaze:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father... We must try. Caesar looks at his son, emotional:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, son. (he turns to the others) More apes die everyday. And we cannot hide here much longer. Caesar looks back down at the map, deep in thought; then feels the anxious stares of the apes around him. He looks them, trying to reassure, though he is still uncertain himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will find a way out... He raises his fists and brings them together, solemn:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apes together strong. They return the gesture, nodding faithfully at their lead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small cave in the upper levels of the fortress, enclose one side by the ROARING FALLS. Caesar sits up, awake, as family sleeps around him. Troubled, he studies Blue Eyes' map in his lap -- when suddenly he feels something... Caesar looks down to see Cornelius instinctively hugging leg as he rests, nuzzled beside his mother. Caesar gazes down protectively at his little one, strokes his head, th turns to look back at the map -- when he notices Blue Eye staring up at him through heavy lidded eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Can't sleep?] Caesar shakes his head, his worried gaze returning to the map. Finally, Blue Eyes reaches out and touches his fathe arm; Caesar turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Trust me, father. This is a risk worth taking.] Moved, Caesar nods; he reaches out and gratefully caresse his son's face, then SIGNS, smiling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I am so proud of you.] (then) [I love you, son.] -- when suddenly a SHIMMERING GREEN LIGHT washes briefly both their faces... Startled, Caesar looks up at the falls to SEE -- -- THREE SHAPES distorted surreally in the water, each ha in green light as they descend rapidly from view. Unnerved, Caesar sits up, unsure of what he's just seen. Blue Eyes watches as his father approaches the falls wari moving in very close... when Caesar sees a STRANGE THIN L whipping about in the current...? He reaches toward THE LINE, mystified -- then plunges his deep in the water, grasping for it -- -- he pulls the line toward him... revealing a taut secti of RED NYLON CLIMBING ROPE, straining against the current Alarmed, Caesar immediately turns back to Blue Eyes and signs, urgent:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Stay here. Protect your mother and brother.] Blue Eyes nods with growing concern as Caesar heads out -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the INCESSANT, OMINOUS ROAR of the waterfall as T FIGURES enter the rock corridor, shrouded in DARKNESS... The sweeping, green beams of THREE RIFLE'S LASER SITES bl on, one by one, as the figures sneak forward through mist At a fork in the catacombs, one silently signals for the others to go one way; he goes the other...

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER DARK CATACOMB
dialogues.text: CAESAR creeps cautiously down the narrow, winding passage picking up speed... He hugs the wall, rounding a bend -- -- when he comes face-to-face with A HULKING FIGURE! Caes leaps back, startled -- then finds it's Luca. Standing gu with a rifle, the gorilla looks surprised to see Caesar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Sorry, Caesar.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [How many others on patrol?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Five?   Six--?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Get them!     Rocket too!]

dialogues.speaker: BLUE EYES
dialogues.text: Crouched behind rocks in the family dwelling. He gestures protectively to Cornelia and the toddler to stay behind h as he anxiously stares at -- A GREEN LASER BEAM slowly approaching in the dark rock corridor just outside their cave... a HUSHED VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lima-two to command. Colonel, intel's good. I'm in the target area. Are you close? Blue Eyes tightens his grip on a SPEAR in his hand... on him, as he waits, coiled to pounce -- The green glow of the beam spills into the cave, sweeping interior, getting closer, closer -- when -- Blue Eyes SPRINGS FORWARD! STAY ON a terrified Cornelia a the toddler as we HEAR a sudden VIOLENT SCUFFLE, chaotic flashes of green illuminating Cornelia's horrified reacti The space finally goes quiet, and we -- CUT WIDE TO SEE BLUE EYES IN PROFILE, standing over the b of the intruder; it's LANG, the tattooed female soldier, rifle on the floor a few feet away. Blue Eyes clutches hi spear, catching his breath -- when --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A second OUT OF FOCUS FIGURE creeps silently into the f.g Blue Eyes unaware as another green beam quickly moves up body, finally coming to rest on the back of his head...

dialogues.speaker: SIMULTANEOUS
dialogues.text: Yet ANOTHER BEAM scans the pitch black passage as a FIGUR moves stealthily toward us. He WHISPERS into his headset:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lima-four to command.   Colonel, did you get him--? -- when suddenly A SHAPE tackles him from behind -- SMASH the Soldier against the walls like a rag doll -- SILENCED MUZZLE FLASHES STROBING as the soldier involuntarily pull the trigger! The space goes black again as the Soldier is dropped in a heap. A SILENT BEAT. Then, approaching TORCHLIGHT flickers on t walls... revealing the shape to be ROCKET; he reaches dow and grimly retrieves the gun from the dead soldier on the ground. Rocket looks up as Caesar and Luca arrive with th torch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket!   What happened?! Rocket signs urgently to Caesar -- pointing to the body:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I heard him talking!   The Colonel is here!] Caesar's eyes go wide -- he takes the torch from Luca, mo down close to look at the body... immediately recognizing TRAVIS, the defiant soldier whose life he spared. Suddenl an eerie crackle comes back over Travis' headset:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99, target acquired!... Caesar picks up the dislodged headset, raises it to his e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Repeat, target is down! I got him. Let's go! I can get out from here! Caesar's face goes ashen as horror dawns...

dialogues.speaker: A HUMAN HAND
dialogues.text: fishing out the red nylon climbing rope from the waterfal it starts to clip the rope to an anchor on a belt --

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR
dialogues.text: BOUNDING FULL-TILT through the corridor, faster, faster - until he bursts into

dialogues.speaker: HIS FAMILY DWELLING
dialogues.text: Panicked, heart-racing, Caesar's eyes FIND --

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL J. WESLEY MCCULLOUGH
dialogues.text: Silhouetted by the waterfall as he finishes securing the to his belt. He turns to face us -- and Caesar -- for the very first time: a striking, nightmarish image -- his fac covered in shocks of dark camo grease, head completely shaved, a full unruly beard, wild eyes just visible behin graduated aviator sunglasses. His presence is chilling. The Colonel's eyes blaze, stunned at the sight of Caesar. Confused, his gaze flits to something on the floor -- Cae follows his stare to discover --

dialogues.speaker: BLUE EYES, LIFELESS ON THE GROUND, CORNELIA DEAD BESIDE H
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON CAESAR as time seems to stop -- he's reeling, hi entire world crashing in -- his eyes lift to the Colonel, wave of rage rushing over him -- when -- THE COLONEL quickly swings his gun off his shoulder -- Caesar DODGES FOR COVER behind the rocks -- as -- The Colonel FIRES -- From the corridor we hear the furious ROAR OF INCOMING AP The Colonel yells into his headset, backing toward the fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out! Now!! Then he turns -- and LEAPS STRAIGHT THROUGH THE WATERFALL Caesar raises his head just in time to see --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE COLONEL, barely discernible through the rushing water clutching the swinging rope -- as HE'S PULLED UPWARD! Apes spill into the cave as Caesar, desperate with rage, jumps to his feet, charging after the Colonel -- the apes watch in shock as -- CAESAR LUNGES INTO THE FALLS TOO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar crashes through the water, hands flailing for -- THE ROPE! He grabs at it -- IT CAREENS WILDLY!      Caesa on tight, looks up to see -- THE COLONEL high above -- clinging to the suddenly jerkin line -- he looks down to see CAESAR starting to climb up furiously after him... The Colonel, unfazed, seizes a KNIFE from his boot as -- Caesar closes in, climbing, about to reach him -- when -- THE COLONEL CUTS THE LINE -- and -- Caesar PLUMMETS -- down, down, down -- INTO THE RIVER BEL An excruciating beat -- then Caesar SPRINGS UP from the water, gasping, enraged -- he peers up in agony to SEE -- THE COLONEL disappearing over the TOP OF THE CLIFF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Cornelia and Blue Eyes, as their lifeless bodies lifted from the rock floor... REVEAL CAESAR watching silently, lost in his own world; s wet, he remains completely motionless, consumed with rage pain. Beside him, Rocket, Luca and Maurice watch, shaken, the bodies are carried away. Just then Spear pushes through, reporting to Luca:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Luca! We can't find Winter.   He wasn't at his post.] Luca and Maurice suddenly exchange a worried look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [He was scared. Could he have turned against us?]

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks to Rocket as well -- but Rocket's gaze is now fi elsewhere. Maurice and the others all turn to see -- CAESAR has been following their conversation.     Finally signs, wracked with guilt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Caesar... I think Winter betrayed us. I'm sorry. He was in my command.] Caesar remains silent; then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My youngest son...   Have you found him yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We're still looking.] Maurice turns to the others:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Let's help them search.] Everyone nods, following Maurice's lead as they shuffle o giving Caesar some much-needed space... Finally -- Caesar is alone. His eyes move to where he found Blue Eyes and Cornelia; t is blood on the floor. He steps closer, in a trance; sees TWO BRASS BULLET CASINGS on the ground. Caesar crouches, expression intensifying as he reaches for the spent casin -- when he hears a NOISE behind him -- on a hair-trigger, Caesar seizes the spear, raising it furiously -- so gripp by animalistic rage that it takes a moment to realize -- his toddler son, peeking out from hiding in the rocks; Cornelius peers up in terror at his father, shrinking bac Caesar returns to his senses, lowers the spear... then, softening, he bends to the toddler and extends a hand... Cornelius is still too frightened to approach, his eyes f on the spear in Caesar's grasp. Ashamed, Caesar sets the spear on the ground, then holds arms out to his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cornelius... you're safe now, son.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The child finally comes, reluctantly... Caesar, growing emotional, pulls him into a powerful embrace. We HOLD TIG on CAESAR, pain etched deeply on his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire ape community is here, urgently loading up the horses, preparing for the imminent exodus. HEADS TURN as CAESAR makes his way through the crowd; clutching a rifle one hand and holding his little son's hand in the other, fixed ahead as he crosses to -- LAKE, who stands by her horse, surrounded by Maurice, Luc and Rocket on theirs. Caesar looks at Lake. He seems stoi but his eyes belie heartbreak, and something deeper... tremendous rage:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You loved my son.    Look after his brother until I return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) [You're not coming with us?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Caesar crouches down to Cornelius, caresses his little so one last time, then guides him to Lake. ANGLE ON Rocket and Luca; they exchange a look, shocked. Maurice looms behind them on horseback, watching it all t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Caesar!    You're not going after them?!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not them... Him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Caesar, you are our leader!   We can't leave without you!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must.    The soldiers will be back soon.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Caesar looks for one last time at his son -- Cornelius cr out as Lake tries to comfort him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Father!] But Caesar remains unrelenting, already completely consum by his dark, vengeful quest as he starts to head off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the apes around him) When I find him, the soldiers will all come after me. That may give you the best chance to get out of the woods. Until then, be safe. And with that he moves straight for his horse. As the reality that their leader is leaving them sets in, the ap community begins to react in anxious protest -- shockwave HOOTS rise as Caesar mounts his horse. ON MAURICE, ROCKET AND LUCA watching Caesar amidst the growing turmoil -- they stare after him in total disbelie

dialogues.speaker: THE APE EXODUS
dialogues.text: A seemingly endless line of ape refugees. Spear leads the procession; armed apes in warpaint guard the group, paren protectively clutching their children, others help the injured along -- as they set off uncertainly for the peri journey ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar rides alone, rifle in hand, the sound of the ape exodus now barely audible in the distance. Suddenly, he hears RUSTLING behind him. He turns, stops, alert. As the sound gets closer, we recognize the CLOP OF HOOVES -- the MAURICE, ROCKET, and LUCA appear, riding out of the trees They come to a halt, eyes on Caesar. Caesar returns a har look, shakes his head. But Luca is undeterred:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The soldiers' camp is always moving. My guards think they know where it is. Let me take you.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You'll need me to back you up.] Rocket reveals a rifle in his hand.    But Caesar remains

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Please... I know what it's like... to lose a son.] That strikes a chord; Caesar looks at him, affected...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might not make it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [That's why I'm coming.   To make sure you do.] Caesar looks at his three friends, moved, torn...

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR, MAURICE, ROCKET AND LUCA
dialogues.text: Riding silently through woods, close together. A posse. HOLD on this iconic image of the foursome; then CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse making their descent, when they see -- SMOKE rising from an old shack across the way. They look at each other, slowing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [This is where the guards thought they might be. There are always fires burning.]

dialogues.speaker: PEEKING THROUGH THE TREES
dialogues.text: As we move closer, we discover we are at the edge of --

dialogues.speaker: A DESERTED R.V. PARK
dialogues.text: Old campers lined up, long-since abandoned. Smoke billows from a weathered stovepipe poking through the window of a rusted-out Airstream trailer. The only sign of life.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON CAESAR, MAURICE, ROCKET AND LUCA
dialogues.text: spying through the trees on foot, looking apprehensive. T exchange uncertain looks -- could this be the base camp? They creep out of the trees for a closer look -- when -- A LONE MAN carrying firewood emerges from the forest. He's mid-40s, dirty, unshaven. Seeing the apes, he stops his tracks. They all stare, a silent stand-off... Then, very, very slowly, he starts to lower his pile of wood:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna... put this down -- He drops the wood suddenly, revealing a RIFLE strapped to shoulder -- he whips it around -- and FIRES! The shot JUS MISSES MAURICE, when -- BANG!   THE MAN DROPS DEAD.   Stunned, the apes turn to s CAESAR clutching his SMOKING GUN, staring distantly at th man he's just killed. The others regard Caesar's grim, steady presence, a bit in shock at his seeming lack of remorse; a look in his eyes suggests even he knows someth has broken within him. A line has been crossed. Finally, Caesar lowers his rifle -- only now aware of the stares. He turns away, ignoring them, steps toward the ma The others join him, looking down at the body. The tatter rags he wears are barely recognizable as the fatigues wor the human soldiers. "A" is crudely tattooed on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Is he out here alone?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Maybe he's a deserter?] Caesar doesn't respond, eyes on the dead man -- when a MU CRASH comes from behind; they all turn to THE AIRSTREAM..

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: Suddenly a door is ripped open, and light spills in; we a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faces of the apes slowly appear, gazing warily in at Caesar and Rocket have their guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They stalk silently into the dim space, eyes roaming... I long and narrow, lined with rotted wood panelling, packed littered with improvised survivalist essentials. We MOVE with them as Caesar leads the group through the claustrophobic interior, anxiously scanning for any place human might be hiding... Moving inexorably toward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the far end of the trailer. The others exchange tense looks as Caesar readies his gun -- and SMASHES down the d ON CAESAR, eyes blazing, furiously training his gun as he sees something; he freezes, poised to kill, and we REVEAL

dialogues.speaker: A LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: cowering like a frightened animal against the wall in a l bunk bed. She looks no more than 8 or 9 years old. A litt waif-like figure, her unwashed face is framed by wildly matted hair. She stares wide-eyed up at -- Caesar, gun still trained on her, adrenaline coursing thr his veins... The faces of the other apes appear behind hi shocked at what they see. Finally, Maurice reaches over, places a hand on Caesar's gently lowers it. Caesar returns to his senses... but sti shows no compassion for the human child. He turns away, t the others, gesturing coldly at the trailer behind them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around. Take what we can use. Caesar steps out past them; Rocket and Luca share an unea look, then follow. But Maurice remains, eyeing the scared little Girl with a mixture of curiosity and pity. He spots something on the floor by the bed, starts to move toward it... Terrified, the Girl scoots back against the wall, withdra as far as she can. But Maurice coos a comforting pant-hoo as he reaches down to the floor and retrieves -- A CRUDELY-MADE RAG DOLL. He holds it out. She hesitates - then quickly grabs it and retreats to her corner, hugging Maurice watches her, then raises his arm, reaching for he She freezes, nervous eyes following his enormous hand... his finger straightens... and gently strokes the doll's h

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She blinks up, studying him, fear ebbing; she opens her m to speak, but no words come, just GENTLE, GASPING GRUNTS.

dialogues.speaker: A DUSTY COMPASS IN A BATTERED OLD LOCKBOX
dialogues.text: REVEAL LUCA picking it up, as he, Caesar and Rocket searc the trailer. Luca sees a PAIR OF BINOCULARS in the box; h takes them too, along with some FLASHLIGHTS. Impatient, Caesar looks back, wondering where Maurice is when Maurice appears in the doorway, the Girl visible beh him, staring out curiously. Maurice signs to Caesar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Something wrong with her.   I don't think she can speak.] Caesar looks coldly at the Girl, then back to Maurice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar and Rocket mount their horses as Luca arrives with others. Maurice is about to climb up when he notices -- The Girl has followed them out. She wanders toward the de Man, his gun still a few feet away. She stares at him, looking lost, but not quite sad. Instead she exhibits a strange, almost primitive fascination with his lifeless b They all gaze at her, uncertain.   Maurice turns to Caesa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [She'll die out here alone.] Caesar looks at her, a flash of pity in his eyes... but h pushes it away, turns to Maurice, firm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot take her. Maurice considers this, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I understand...] (then:) [But I cannot leave her.] Caesar stares at him, frustrated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse on the move again. The Girl rides behind Mauric arms around him, her cheek pressed into his furry back. Caesar takes in the sight, shoots Maurice a hard look... Maurice returns an assuring nod: it'll be okay. Just then, Luca GRUNTS for their attention. They all turn see CROSSES UP AHEAD ON THE SIDE OF THE TRAIL, crudely-bo branches staked into the ground. They approach warily, stopping as they discover -- A LARGE GRAVEYARD amidst the trees. A sea of crosses, marking mounds of dirt. They peer around, a bit unnerved:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Must be where they bury the dead.] Rocket nods, when Caesar suddenly notices the TREE TRUNKS scarred with BULLET HOLES... He glances at the ground, finding scattered BRASS BULLET CASINGS; perplexed, he poi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like some were killed here. They all look at the shot-up trees and casings, bewildere when Luca sees a pile of ASHES and CHARRED OBJECTS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [They burned their things too.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Why would they kill their own men?] ON CAESAR, mulling the mystery -- when Luca lets out anot GRUNT; they turn as he points through the trees at pinpri of FIRE LIGHT and TENTS in the distance. It's the base ca Caesar tenses in grim anticipation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEARCHING the FIELD OF TENTS in the blue twilight. We FIN huge "A" stencilled on the side of one of them. Re-focus HAND-PAINTED SIGNAGE beside it: "Those who forget the pas are doomed to repeat it." Next to it: "The only good Kong a dead Kong." An eerie, almost cult-like atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL CAESAR
dialogues.text: crouched in brush, spying through the binoculars scavenge from the Airstream. Luca and Rocket are pressed beside hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF TURNCOAT APES walk into view -- the binoculars follow them as they cross to an area where LARGE GROUPS O SOLDIERS are gathered around CAMP FIRES; as the apes begi dutifully pouring drink into the humans' cups, one turns toward us -- we recognize him as RED. The apes watch Caesar peering; when suddenly his expressi hardens. He slowly lowers the glasses, anger burning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Did you find the Colonel...?] Caesar just hands the binoculars to Luca, who lifts them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside Red, the OTHER APE HAS TURNED TOWARD US, serving t humans... As Luca FOCUSES, we recognize him, as Caesar whispers his name ominously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're inside the human camp now. Red and Winter quietly ladle stew from a bucket to Soldiers sitting around the f A volatile soldier with tortured eyes (BOYLE) calls out i low, menacing voice to Winter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey.   Over here. Winter hesitates, flustered -- Red notices, immediately intercedes, anxiously trying to placate Boyle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok -- Ok... He come... He nods at Winter to hurry over; he does. Boyle holds out his bowl. Winter takes it, filling it quickly -- some ste spills on Boyle's boot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Hey!     You stupid-- !

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WHAP! as Boyle KICKS the bowl right out of Winter's hand and Winter reacts with an instinctive SNARL! Boyle grabs gun, points it right at him. Winter FREEZES -- then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Boyle... Boyle turns to see PREACHER, the fresh-faced kid, beside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Preacher -- what're you, a donkey lover now? I think you going soft coz that kong let you go. Some of the soldiers snicker. Preacher backs down, humiliated and angry. Boyle levels his gun at Winter agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a new bowl. Winter looks nervously to Red.       Red nods soberly: do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter digs under a supply table for a new bowl. Rising, catches his reflection in a grimy mirror over a wash basi He hesitates, maybe suffering a crisis of conscience -- w he sees A REFLECTED FACE lurking in the shadows behind hi He spins to see CAESAR standing there, motionless, starin Panicked, Winter turns for the exit -- but LUCA is there, blocking escape. Turns the other way -- and there's ROCKE Winter's eyes widen as Caesar takes a slow step toward hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the Colonel? Winter swallows, trembling as he lifts his hands to sign:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [He's gone.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dubious, stalking closer) ...Gone? Winter looks at the other apes, sees them closing in too. Turns back to Caesar, nervously explaining:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [This morning. He took many soldiers with him.]

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Luca and Rocket exchange troubled glances... but Caesar's eyes remain fixed on Winter as he continues his approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Men are coming down here В­- from their base in the north. The Colonel and his soldiers are going to meet them at the border.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What border? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I don't know. But more of us are leaving to join them in the morning. Red thinks they'll all be coming back here... to help the Colonel finish off the apes for good.] Caesar finally stops, right in front of him.    Winter pl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Please... I know I betrayed you. But can't you see? We'll never beat them. I was just trying to survive. Red told me the humans promised to spare us if we helped. I beg you, forgive me...] But Caesar is unmoved, barely stifling his rage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son... my wife... are dead. Just then -- we hear the LAUGHTER OF HUMANS outside; Wint turns, sees SHADOWS OF SOLDIERS passing on the side of th tent -- he opens his mouth to shriek to them -- but a HAN CLAMPS over his mouth, as Caesar wrestles him to the grou to silence him! The others rush in, holding Winter down a he struggles violently, desperately trying to shriek out The SHADOWS OF THE SOLDIERS HALT, their laughter subsidin their heads turn toward the muffled sounds in the tent -- Seeing this, Caesar furiously tightens his grip around Winter's neck -- but Winter won't stop, struggling even harder! Eyes fixed on the human shadows, Caesar grips fiercely... choking tighter and tighter... ...until Winter finally relents. Caesar watches the shado tense... And at last, they move on. The apes exhale relief. Luca and Rocket turn to Caesar -- but their eyes drift to Winter.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Caesar follows their looks down to the young gorilla in h grasp... and discovers he has killed him. Stunned, he stares at Winter's lifeless face... then, slo looks up again at Luca and Rocket, grappling with what he done. They lower their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tense silence. The apes and Girl sit by a fire, isolated the trees; Maurice studies Caesar's face as he gazes into flames, deeply unsettled. Then Maurice turns to the other who look equally plagued. Finally, Rocket turns to Mauric

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Winter had it coming!] Maurice nods, uneasy; Luca looks up, convincing himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Caesar had no choice!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [So what do we do now?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Wait for the soldiers to leave.   Follow them to the Colonel.] Maurice turns again to Caesar, who is still in his own wo lifting a gourd canteen to his lips. He takes a drink... when, out of the corner of his eye, he sees the Girl besi him, staring at him guilelessly. He looks at her askance for a moment, deadpan, then hands the gourd, and she guzzles thirstily. Caesar watches -- -- when suddenly his eyes shift, startled to discover a D FIGURE on the other side of the fire... Alarmed and bewildered, Caesar peers through the flames.. amazed to see it's AN APE sitting across from him, his he lowered ominously. Fire dances on Caesar's pupils as he stares at the figure, haunted... ...when suddenly, the Ape lifts his face, grinning at Cae through the distorting waves of heat -- Caesar looks haun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Koba?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ape... not kill ape...

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON CAESAR
dialogues.text: snapping awake with a start -- we are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar catches his breath, lying disoriented on the groun when he hears activity around him. He turns, finding Maur standing over him -- he signs urgently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The soldiers are going!] Caesar turns to see Rocket and Luca twenty feet away, crouching anxiously behind the trees, peering into the distance -- we hear the APPROACHING THUNDER of horses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grand vista of Mill Valley in the distance. A SMALL ARM OF HUMANS ON HORSEBACK DESCENDS on the hills below us... OUR POSSE arrives in the foreground. Caesar looks with determination down at the humans as the recede... He urges his horse forward; the others follow..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINDS BLAST SNOW in all directions...

dialogues.speaker: A WHITEOUT
dialogues.text: Our posse are no more than DIM SHAPES pressing blindly to us, battling the elements, lost... TIGHT ON CAESAR'S EYES squinting hard, fighting to see... He peers into the maelstrom spying -- BRAKE LIGHTS up ahe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Is that them up ahead?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tense) [Looks like they stopped!] Caesar urgently raises his hand to stop his posse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Don't let them see us!] He is already off his horse -- when DISTANT GUN BLASTS ec through the air! They all rush to the side of the road, huddling together -- as MORE SHOTS RING OUT up ahead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Caesar) [What are they shooting at?!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: A SILENT, UTTERLY STILL, SNOW-COVERED TRAIL
dialogues.text: The blizzard has stopped. With a SOFT CRUNCH of snow, we see our posse ride cautiou into view, eyes anxiously scanning the trail for the pres of the humans... Rocket SIGNS cautiously to the group --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [They're gone...] As he approaches, Caesar sees something -- he stops his horse:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unnerved) What is that...? As Caesar and the others dismount, REVEAL SMALL WOODEN X THE SIDE OF THE ROAD; they move toward the Xs to discover THREE BODIES DRAPED IN SNOW. Maurice tucks the Girl protectively behind him, as Caesar reaches down and brush snow off them... revealing THREE ALPHA OMEGA SOLDIERS, bu wounds in their backs, HOODS OVER HEADS, execution-style. Caesar pulls one of the hoods off -- the soldier is a WOM her eyes are open, lifeless, dried blood under her nostri Rocket pulls off another hood... a lanky, young, MALE SOLDIER, eyes shut. He too has dried blood under his nose Rocket inches closer to look at his face -- when THE SOLDIER'S EYES SNAP OPEN -- he GASPS at the sight of them The apes are startled as the panicked Soldier begins frantically scrambling away -- Caesar moves after him -- places a hand firmly on his leg --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why... did they shoot you? He just stares back, blinking without understanding -- wh he notices the Girl, staring at him from behind Maurice. two lock eyes warily, like creatures in the wild. And the the Soldier opens his mouth as if trying to speak... but makes no sound, only GASPING GRUNTS, just like the Girl's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struck; to Caesar) [He can not speak either...?] The apes all exchange looks; Caesar turns to Rocket:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me get him up... Rocket reaches down toward the Soldier -- but the Soldier freaks, wide eyes darting ferally, wildly scrambling on h back to get away from them -- Caesar moves toward him, tr to calm him -- but it only spooks him more -- he rolls on his knees and takes off RUNNING... The apes watch, stunned, as he disappears into the woods. Finally, Caesar turns back, looking at the bodies again.. and then the Girl. Maurice catches his eye:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What is wrong with them...?] Caesar just shakes his head: I don't know...      And we

dialogues.speaker: ATOP A TALL RADIO TOWER
dialogues.text: Caesar, Maurice, Rocket, and Luca urgently climb into vie snow swirls around them; cold, out of breath, they anxiou scan the colossal Sierra snowscape, stretching out endles around them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Where could they have gone?!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter said they were heading to a border...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Yes, but which way is that?!]

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: The Girl sits on Maurice's horse, craning her neck all th way back to stare up at the apes high above; as she glanc back down to play with the rag doll in her hands -- an OU FOCUS FIGURE IN A GREEN PARKA silently passes behind her. CLOSE ON DARK, WEATHERED SNOW BOOTS creeping up and stopp next to the legs of one of the horses -- We watch THE BACK OF THE FIGURE'S HEAD, covered beneath t FUR-LINED HOOD of the bulky parka, as his unseen hands rummage stealthily through a saddle-bag. His breath steam quietly around him. He FREEZES as A FLASHLIGHT drops into the snow by his boots -- But the Girl remains focused on her doll, unaware. The Figure resumes rummaging, finally pausing as we BRIEF GLIMPSE the BARREL OF A SHOTGUN he has just found --

dialogues.speaker: UP IN THE TREE TOPS
dialogues.text: A NERVOUS SNORT comes from one of the horses below -- the apes turn to see the TINY FIGURE IN THE BULKY PARKA FAR B digging in the saddle bag; Luca lets out a TERRIFYING ROA The Girl finally looks up, startled, as -- -- the Figure panics, JUMPING ON THE HORSE, AND TAKING OF Caesar and his posse scramble down from the trees -- moun their horses --

dialogues.speaker: GALLOPING THROUGH THE TREACHEROUS OBSTACLE COURSE OF TREE
dialogues.text: The TINY FIGURE in the parka darts in and out of view The apes are starting to gain on him, when he BREAKS OUT the woods and up onto --

dialogues.speaker: A MASSIVE SNOW-COVERED SLOPE
dialogues.text: We watch from HIGH ABOVE as his horse CHARGES THE INCLINE KICKING POWDER INTO THE AIR -- the apes' horses burst out the woods after him -- all of them just tiny dots climbin the stark white landscape...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: From this vantage we can now see the TOPPLED CABLES and DILAPIDATED GONDOLAS that tell us this was once A SKI ARE The apes again begin to close the gap --

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR CHARGING HARD, EYES FIXED ON --
dialogues.text: THE DIM FIGURE up ahead of him -- when suddenly -- BLAM! FLASH OF GUNFIRE ERUPTS from atop the Figure's horse -- CAESAR and the OTHERS DUCK as -- CHING! -- the BLAST RICOCHETS off a half-buried GONDOLA CAR far wide of them! BLAM! BLAM! TWO MORE SHOTS ring out, wildly astray, kicki up snow clouds nowhere near them or their horses -- -- as the Figure disappears over the crest of the slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apes arrive, slowing their horses as they come upon - AN ENORMOUS, ABANDONED VICTORIAN HOTEL, built into the mountainside. An old sign reads: The Inn at Deer Creek. The stolen horse wanders rider-less on the snowy front la The apes cautiously dismount, drawing their weapons... As they approach, a SHADOW SUDDENLY BOLTS from behind one of buildings, dashing into the main lodge -- The apes all exchange looks; then raise their guns as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ornate glass door   slowly opens... Caesar, Rocket, an enter, guns first...    As they pass us, the door swings behind them... HOLD    as Maurice and the Girl wait outsi pressing their faces   to THE FROSTY DOOR PANE -- their e fill with a sense of   amazement as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: PUSHING IN ON THE FROSTY DOOR PA
dialogues.text: Inside the lobby, Caesar, Rocket, and Luca creep away fro into what appears to be a kind of SURREAL ICE PALACE...

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE THE LOBBY
dialogues.text: We MOVE with Caesar and the others, their breath steaming the cold as they peer around them at an extraordinary sig

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Every inch of the cavernous interior -- from furnishings chandeliers -- is covered in THICK CRYSTALLINE ICE, the building having long-since been breached by weather. Snow swirls in the air, drifting down through a hole in the ro Caesar lifts a hand to stop the others as he spots -- BOO PRINTS in the frost on the floor. The apes' eyes follow t across the lobby's expanse... to where they disappear int the black opening of AN ENORMOUS HEARTH along the wall. The apes cautiously close in, guns trained on the hearth, deep and dark enough to conceal whoever's hiding inside.. Caesar stops at the opening; he COCKS his gun LOUDLY, levelling it -- Rocket and Luca COCK their weapons too... ... when suddenly, the STOLEN SHOTGUN is tossed out at th landing at the apes' feet with a thud. They stare down at uneasily -- when to their surprise the STOLEN BINOCULARS skittering out too. And then the COMPASS. The apes exchange a look -- Rocket quickly grabs the shot and the apes wait expectantly, weapons still raised, as - THE FIGURE slowly begins to emerge from the darkness, hea hung remorsefully, still obscured in the hood of the worn parka... He starts to raise his hands in surrender, and a his head lifts... we discover -- HE IS AN APE. A chimp with more skin than hair on his small, rounded he he has oversized ears and a little scruff of beard, his scrawny frame swimming in the big green parka. He stares up at our shocked trio with a sheepish, apologe smile... and finally, he SPEAKS ALOUD in halting grunts, pointing a finger at his own chest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chastising himself) Bad... ape... Bad ape... Our three apes just gape back, no idea what to make of hi Rocket lowers his gun. Then signs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Who are you?] But Bad Ape just tilts his head, not comprehending. Our a exchange uncertain looks. Then Luca turns to Bad Ape, lee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Where are you from?] No answer.    Luca turns to Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I don't think he understands.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Caesar) [I don't recognize him.   He's not one of us.] Caesar regards the odd little chimp a moment; then SPEAKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you... alone here? Bad Ape's eyes dart uneasily from face to face -- it's no clear if he understands this either -- but then he looks at Caesar... and NODS. A soft CREAKING across the lobby causes their heads to tu

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE AND THE GIRL
dialogues.text: stand just inside the entrance, peering back uncertainly them across the giant space. Bad Ape notices the Girl, SHIVERING BADLY beside Maurice. Ape considers her a moment, then lowers his hands -- Rocket lifts his weapon again, wary -- but Bad Ape just continues, removing his parka; finally he holds it out in hand -- calls out to the Girl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold...? No one says anything. Bad Ape turns to Caesar. Holds out the parka, gesturing to the Girl with a tentative smile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold. Caesar stares hesitantly at Bad Ape and the ratty jacket. Finally, he reaches out, accepts it from Bad Ape's finger

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: as Bad Ape starts A FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Warming herself by the flames, the Girl -- now in Bad Ape parka -- sits with Caesar and the others, looking around wonder at SPRAWLING PILES OF BAD APE'S SCAVENGED TREASURE beside the hearth, a hoarder's paradise of dry goods, can food, and an endless array of STOLEN ITEMS and TRINKETS. Bad Ape beams as he stokes the flames for his new guests:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see girl. Think... you human.   But you... apes. Like me! He smiles excitedly -- when he sees the Girl picking up a trinket from a pile: a glinting CHEVY NOVA CAR EMBLEM. He gently snatches it from her, kindly shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering around) You... live here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding quickly) Long time. Long, long time. He suddenly scurries away; puzzled, Caesar watches him as rummages through what looks like a little sleeping area. returns with a small STUFFED CROCODILE, hands it to Caesa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a wistful look) Home. Old home. Confused, Caesar looks down at the stuffed crocodile, fin embroidered on its belly: WORLD FAMOUS SIERRA ZOO. Caesar peers up at him, trying to make sense of this... t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are there more like you?   More apes? From zoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Dead. All dead. Long time. He looks at Caesar, growing solemn as he explains:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humans get sick... Apes get smart... Caesar nods, understanding he means the Simian Flu --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then humans kill apes. But not me... (grins, proud) Not me. I run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You learn to speak...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Listen to human... His face abruptly contorts into an "angry human" expressi he waves a chiding finger as he mimics:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Bad ape!    Bad ape!" Then, turning his head, he realizes the Girl has the shin Chevy Nova emblem again -- he reaches for it, possessive:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently admonishes) No... No touch. She stares at it longingly as he sets it down. He looks b at the apes, smiles -- then rushes away for something els The apes all watch their excitable host, perplexed -- Mau turns to Caesar, signs an aside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Amazing... Always thought we were the only ones. Wonder if there are others out there somewhere? Others like us.] Just as Caesar begins to contemplate the mind-blowing thought, Bad Ape bounds back in, hurriedly passing out packages of vacuum-foiled food rations (M.R.E.'s).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here! Eat, eat! (beaming) New friends. Special day. Bad Ape tears the top off one, starts eating the dehydrat food, nodding encouragingly for them to do the same. Caesar looks slowly down at the ration in his hand -- not an official military seal: "U.S. GOVERNMENT PROPERTY: CA

dialogues.speaker: STATE BORDER QUARANTINE DETENTION AND RELOCATION CENTER"
dialogues.text: TIGHTER on the word: BORDER. Caesar suddenly looks up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this? Bad Ape turns to him, confused. Caesar holds up the packa Bad Ape looks uneasy... his voice lowering to a hush:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad place. Very bad. I find. Long time ago. After zoo. Looking for food. Find human zoo. Zoo for sick. Engrossed, Caesar's eyes meet his... as Bad Ape continues

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big walls. Sick humans try climb. Bad humans kill. Then get sick too. All dead now. All dead. Caesar and the others take this in, somehow haunted.   Th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad humans...? Soldiers? Bad Ape recognizes the word, nods gravely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers. The posse looks to each other with rising intensity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [An old, deserted military camp on the border...?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Maybe this is where the Colonel and the troops from the north are going to meet?] Caesar nods: maybe.    He turns back to Bad Ape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it far?     Can you take us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks agog) Human zoo?! No... No go back there. Everyone dead. I come here. Safe here. Never go back! Caesar reaches out his hand, places it on Bad Ape's shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.     You must take us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!     Can not take!   Can not take! Scared, he pushes Caesar's hand from his shoulder, a litt too hard -- Rocket GRABS him, incensed В­- but Caesar restrains Rocket, shakes his head no. Bad Ape shrinks in Rocket's grasp -- then sees something, and points despera to the little windows along the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! More snow! Can not go, must stay here. (to the others) Look, look! They all look to the massive lobby window to see it is in snowing hard now. Rocket finally releases Bad Ape.     He exhales, looks at with renewed optimism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay here. Eat. Rest. (smiles hopefully) With me. Caesar considers, reluctantly nods to the others. Bad Ape relieved -- when he sees the Girl staring longingly again the Nova emblem; he grabs it, hands it to her ceremonious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.    You keep. He looks around, smiling at the apes for approval; the Gi gazes happily at the emblem, as with a WHISTLING HOWL, we

dialogues.speaker: HIGH OVER THE CAVERNOUS LOBBY
dialogues.text: Snow whirling hard through the ice palace.        HOLD; C

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: The last embers of the fire dying out as everyone sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR
dialogues.text: The only one still awake.    He sits up, eyes settling on THE GIRL, curled into Maurice's belly, hugging her doll; Nova emblem is clutched in her little fingers. Maurice's is draped protectively around her as they sleep.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Caesar stares at the sight, growing sad, his mind distant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is...? Caesar turns, startled to find Bad Ape watching him; Bad nods toward the Girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) But she... with you? Caesar nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has no one else. Bad Ape gazes at the Girl, suddenly feeling sorry for her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you look at her. Just now. (turns back to Caesar) Look sad. But Caesar says nothing.       Bad Ape studies him; then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... have child? Caesar turns -- Bad Ape smiles sweetly, expectantly... bu Caesar just returns a withering look. Bad Ape falls silen Caesar looks away. Then, quietly, stoically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had two.     But one was killed.   By human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly struck) Oh... Soldier? Caesar, still not looking at him, NODS. A silent beat, as Bad Ape looks down, pensive. Then softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had child...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Caesar turns, surprised. Bad Ape stares at the ground, remembering, a little lost. Then slowly, he looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think... you will find him... at human zoo? Soldier? Caesar's eyes drift to the dying embers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Maybe. Bad Ape ponders this.   Torn, he finally looks at Caesar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... maybe I take you. Caesar turns from the fire, their eyes meeting as we CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girl steps out alone onto the deserted porch, still wearing Bad Ape's parka. As she clutches herself against cold, something catches her eye; she looks up overhead at PINK FLOWERS of a perennial dogwood tree, poking through snow -- the only color in an otherwise stark white world. With the muffled crunch of hooves, Luca and Rocket appear guiding the four horses toward the porch. Luca notices the Girl staring up at the branch of flowers He watches a moment, then moves toward her... and reaches long arm up, snapping off a small piece of the branch. The Girl observes as Luca bends down, his massive gorilla face right in front of hers as he very gently slips the flowers behind her ear. She smiles. He blinks back at her sweetly, when -- Caesar and Maurice emerge onto the porch. Luca quickly straightens, resuming his tough guy demeanor. Maurice lowers next to the Girl, and she hops on his back He moves to his horse, and climbs up with her. Caesar, Rocket and Luca mount up as well, when -- -- the front door SQUEAKS open; they turn to see Bad Ape stepping out to join them. He wears boots, an old wool blanket on his shoulders, and a striped toque on his head

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Caesar and the others stare at him, deadpan, but he is oblivious, looking from horse to horse, wondering where h supposed to go. Luca GRUNTS gruffly, points him toward Rocket's horse. Ape smiles, and starts for Rocket's horse. Rocket looks miserable as Bad Ape struggles to climb up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group silently weaves its way through snow-covered tr The Girl watches curiously as Caesar removes his canteen his saddle bag. Maurice notices her staring, follows her gaze to see Caesar drinking. Maurice grunts softly to her She turns, and he gestures at Caesar, making the sign for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Thirsty.] (repeats for her, teaching) [Thirsty.] She just stares blankly at Maurice. He takes her small ha in his, demonstrating the way to sign the word. Caesar notices, lowering his canteen, quietly intrigued. Maurice demonstrates again. But the Girl shows no interes or understanding. Her eyes return to Caesar -- who for th first time softens, offering a sympathetic gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group have left the trail, moving through dense fores Caesar watches Bad Ape who peers anxiously ahead... to wh SUNLIGHT spills in at the edge of the woods. Bad Ape turn to meet Caesar's eyes, fearful:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There... Caesar looks at the light, then turns to the others, rais his hand for them to stop.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE OF THE WOODS
dialogues.text: On foot now, the group presses in close behind the trees the forest's perimeter, squinting into the hard, low sun

dialogues.speaker: AN ENORMOUS CANYON BELOW THEM
dialogues.text: Steep, snow-covered granite cliffs slope down in shelves, disappearing into an unseen expanse below. The TOP OF A MASSIVE, PRISON-STYLE WARDEN'S TOWER pokes ominously up in the distance, from the center of the chas Caesar raises the binoculars, PEERING AT THE TOWER: sun flares off the cement and steel structure, stained with corrosion. Through the windows, it appears to be DESERTED Caesar lowers the glasses, staring uncertainly -- when he notices something about the FADED CALIFORNIA STATE FLAG hanging from the tower -- he looks through the binoculars examine it: the flag is hung upside-down... and a HUGE "A has been painted in black across it. Then Caesar suddenly notices movement down below -- he sh the glasses to find TINY SILHOUETTED FIGURES, just barely visible along the edge of the lowest visible shelf. Caesar turns, looks from face to face... then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Luca, let's take a closer look.] (to Rocket) [Stay here. Keep them safe.] Rocket nods dutifully, and Caesar and Luca start off --

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: The HEAVILY SILHOUETTED FIGURES in the distance are still small, but from this closer vantage we can see now they'r the midst of placing a series of about twelve MYSTERIOUS, SHAPED STRUCTURES along the cliff's edge -- maybe this is some kind of defensive perimeter...? REVEAL CAESAR LOWERING HIS BINOCULARS; he looks confused he turns to Luca, lying beside him on the edge of a ridge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What are they doing?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Caesar turns back, looking through the binoculars again, trying to decipher this strange activity -- when Luca GRU at him with quiet alarm. Caesar turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points) [What's that? A patrol?] Caesar looks --

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: finding a PAIR OF HORSES on a ledge right below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't see riders... Suddenly AN OUT OF FOCUS SHAPE RISES directly in front of binoculars -- Caesar drops the glasses to discover -- AN ALPHA OMEGA SOLDIER looming right above him, rifle rai The soldier pulls the trigger -- CLICK -- but the gun is jammed! Panicked, the soldier rears back, about to lunge forward with the rifle's BAYONET -- when -- LUCA DIVES PROTECTIVELY in front of Caesar -- -- taking the bayonet blade in his gut as he YANKS the ma down, WRESTLING him to the ground! They roll violently, finally coming to a stop, Luca atop the motionless soldie Caesar's eyes land on the BLOOD-STAINED BAYONET, lying in snow beside them -- he scrambles up, rushing to Luca -- -- when a SECOND SOLDIER steps out, startling Caesar -- a to shoot -- when -- WHAM! THE SECOND SOLDIER CRUMPLES, revealing Rocket behin him, having just clubbed him with the butt of a rifle. Rocket looks to Caesar, signs regretfully, out of breath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I saw them from up there... Coming for you...] They both turn immediately to Luca... who is rolling painfully off the dead man; he looks at them helplessly, GASPING, clutching his gut... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: BACK UP IN THE WOODS
dialogues.text: Waiting anxiously at the edge of the trees, Bad Ape, Maur and the Girl stare as -- ROCKET returns, climbing quickly up toward them, a grim expression on his face, clutching the bayoneted rifle in hand... right behind him, CAESAR CARRIES LUCA across his back, like a Vietnam soldier shouldering a fallen brother They all retreat into the safety of the woods, the group converging around Caesar as he lowers Luca to the ground. Emotion in his eyes, Caesar looks down at his loyal frien Fading fast, Luca smiles weakly. He manages to raise a ha holding it out to Caesar; Caesar grasps it firmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [At least this time... I was able to protect you...] Deeply affected, Caesar holds Luca's gaze a silent moment and then Luca releases his grasp, his hand drifting to th ground as the rest of the group looks on. Her eyes fixed the massive gorilla, the Girl climbs off Maurice's back.. The others watch, surprised, as she approaches Luca, clim onto his chest. She stares down, her little face inches f his... for the first time we see deep emotion in her eyes Luca peers up vulnerably as she removes the twig of flowe he placed behind her ear... and gently tucks it behind hi she begins to cry. Caesar is struck by her display of emotion. Luca smiles at her, then gradually his smile fad as his face grows still... and life ebbs from his eyes. TIGHT ON CAESAR, staring intensely at Luca, a mixture of and guilt in his eyes. The others watch him silently. Finally, Maurice ventures a SOFT GRUNT to him. Caesar tur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I know how much you have lost... But now we have lost another.] Caesar just stares, inscrutable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Please... it's not too late to leave this place. To rejoin the others.] Emotion stirring, Rocket cannot hold back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Luca gave his life!   We can not turn back -- !] Maurice remains fixed on Caesar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Caesar...] But Caesar turns away. He shakes his head grimly; then utters quietly, consumed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must pay... Everyone stares, until finally, Caesar turns back. His ey meet Maurice's, whose gaze now appears judgemental:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Now you sound like Koba.] Caesar turns to his friend, suddenly seething; the look i his eyes is chilling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Koba? You know nothing.   My wife and son were killed. (gestures to Luca) And now my friend. (then, harder) You call me Koba...?! Caesar glares at him, an unprecedented rift between them. Rocket remains still, taken aback... waiting... Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling with rage) I did not ask you to come. Any of you. This is my fight. I will finish it alone... Go now. Join the others. Stunned, they watch as Caesar rises, and takes the bayone rifle from Rocket's shoulder... then heads off, back towa the canyon... HOLD on the apes' harrowed expressions, watching him; CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWOOPING OVER Caesar's tiny figure as he scales down the vast, snowy expanse in the moonlight; he DROPS down to a lower shelf, and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREATHING HARD (O.S.), MOVING toward the CLIFF'S EDGE -- massive guard tower reaches up from the canyon beyond it ON CAESAR, air steaming from his nose; he SLOWS, SEEING - THE TWELVE MYSTERIOUS X-SHAPED STRUCTURES looming ahead - As he approaches we can suddenly start to make out DARK F STRAPPED to them...? Caesar's expression moves from confusion... to dawning horror as he realizes: the forms appear to be APES. He picks up speed again, rushing towar them, their backs to us -- it's unclear whether the forms dead or alive... Finally reaching the line of crosses at the edge of the cliff, he finds a GROUP OF APES, all semi-conscious, struggling to breathe, bound to Xs by their hands and fee Reeling, Caesar whips his head from ape to ape, trying to make sense of this -- when he HEARS A DREADFUL MURMUR RIS from the canyon; heart racing, he spins, staggering towar the edge to PEER DOWN --

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE CANYON
dialogues.text: at what looks like a ENORMOUS, FORMER PRISON CAMP at the of the sheer mountains, three stories below. As Caesar is drawn inexorably to the very edge of the cli OUTDOOR HOLDING PENS come slowly into view... INSIDE THE PENS ARE HUNDREDS OF APES, MURMURING helplessly... THE EXODUS HAS BEEN CAPTURED. Caesar stumbles back from the edge, overwhelmed, in shock He turns in panic to the bound apes -- suddenly recognizi SPEAR among them. He rushes to Spear's side. Spear looks like he's near death, his head sagging. Caesa lifts Spear's face in both hands -- Spear's eyes slowly o as they focus on Caesar, he can't believe what he's seein Caesar yanks the bayonet off his rifle, quickly cuts Spea down. Spear slumps to his knees -- Caesar crouches to ste him as Spear struggles to sign, still stunned to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [They came out of nowhere, attacked us... We were sure they would kill us all -- but the Colonel stopped them!] Caesar stares at him, surprised --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [There was madness in his eyes! He said they would use us, before we died.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [They've been forcing us to work!] Caesar turns to look below -- when Spear suddenly gives o collapsing. Caesar quickly turns -- seeing brutal LASH MA across Spear's back. Horrified, Caesar lifts Spear up, holding him in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... kind of work...? But Spear struggles for consciousness, his eyes flutterin closed... He begins to collapse -- Caesar is stricken:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- my little son -- is he here...? But Spear just falls to the ground, Caesar watches aghast when an APE FOOT steps right beside him -- Caesar turns, startled -- looks up to see -- RED standing ominously right above him! The BUTT OF RED'S RIFLE comes SLAMMING DOWN into us -- and we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: HOLD for a long moment. Hear the echoing sound of WATER SLOWLY DRIPPING. Then HARD CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: SUPER TIGHT ON CAESAR'S EYES
dialogues.text: as they wince open, disoriented, in pain, his face presse the ground... A SHAFT OF HARSH LIGHT blasts down from abo Water drops splatter around him. Caesar peers around, struggling to get his bearings, his drifting in and out of focus: he finds TRACKS embedded in ground, a rusted-out TRAIN ENGINE in the shadows. The pla was a depot of some kind.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He glances up at the cavernous, curved ceiling; sodium va security lamps shine in through a rip, which leaks meltin snow. And then he notices --

dialogues.speaker: AN OUT OF FOCUS FIGURE LOOMING IN THE DARKNESS
dialogues.text: a few feet away: it's PREACHER, tensely holding his cross looking unsettled as he stands guard... when an unseen VO comes quietly from the shadows as WET FOOTSTEPS approach:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Lee... Wellington and Napoleon... A SHAPE finally enters the light: it's THE COLONEL, who studies Caesar inscrutably:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Custer... and Sitting Bull. (then) You're probably not much of a reader. But this is... this is a big moment. This is... beyond... historic. Caesar glares up at him, rage welling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you...? (then) We came upon your herd... we got lucky. But I was surprised. You weren't with them. They stare at each other an intense beat... Caesar crawls menacingly toward him -- but is instantly YANKED BACK HAR GASPING, Caesar reaches for his throat to discover his wr are shackled and his neck is CHAINED by a NECK COLLAR... Writhing, he turns to see RED cruelly gripping the end of chain. Preacher takes a step closer, levelling his crossb threateningly; Caesar's eyes lock with his. The Colonel watches their stare-down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you don't come to regret sparing his life. He's quite a good shot. The Colonel just watches Caesar a beat; beneath the chill stillness of his eyes we sense something dangerous, damag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you finally come to save your apes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still in pain, seething) I... didn't know they were here. (then) I came for you. The Colonel searches Caesar's ferocious expression, surprised, something dawning on him for the first time:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see... I kill somebody close to you that night...? Caesar looks him right in the eye, unblinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My... family. The Colonel stares down, some mysterious nerve jolted ins him. He comes closer, stands right above Caesar, looking him for a long beat, something about this revelation chur in his mind; Red cautiously tightens his grip on the chai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     I was there to kill you. Caesar just glares up at him, the Colonel so close... Str the Colonel inches even closer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, look at your eyes... they're almost human... (a long beat; then) How did you know I was here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was told you were coming... That others would be joining you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a cryptic beat) Joining me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To finish us off... for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he smiles) Who told you that? But Caesar won't answer. The Colonel just stares at him, then turns to Red and NODS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, let's go. Red quickly responds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok -- ok, Kerna...! Red YANKS Caesar roughly to his feet; Caesar struggles, CHOKING -- as Preacher moves in too -- and we HARD CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: MOVING with the Colonel, Red, and Preacher as they march Caesar into the frozen, desolate yard; Caesar steals a gl back at a CORRODED SIGN over the hangar: CA STATE BORDER

dialogues.speaker: QUARANTINE DETENTION AND RELOCATION CENTER, PROCESSING DE
dialogues.text: As they walk along train tracks, Caesar turns forward, SE SOLDIERS huddled around fires in front of temporary barra killing time -- they stare up at him menacingly -- up ahe

dialogues.speaker: A PAIR OF GUARD TOWERS LOOM
dialogues.text: More HAND-PAINTED SLOGANS hang on signs, recalling the cu like vibe of the base camp. Armed GUARDS stare down as th pass, straightening tensely at the sight of the Colonel -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, Colonel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not even looking at him) Any more trouble tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eager to please) No, sir -- not anymore -- He gestures, and Caesar follows it to the LINE OF TWELVE bound to the Xs on the granite shelf above. The Colonel finally glances up at the Guard, eyes fixing critically -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could use a haircut there, son. (seeing the other guard) You too, soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yessir! Red jerks Caesar's head back in line as they start to pas

dialogues.speaker: HOLDING PENS ON EITHER SIDE OF THEM
dialogues.text: Caesar looks into one of the pens... to see MASSES of CHA GANGED APES peering out mutely, shocked to see him. Caesa stares back at them with tortured empathy -- when to his surprise -- a change comes over their faces, and many beg to avert their eyes... a sense they feel betrayed by him. Stunned, Caesar marches on, devastated by the dawning realization his apes have lost faith in him -- when PLAIN SHRIEKS suddenly seize his attention -- He quickly turns to the other pen... it is filled with AP CHILDREN... they gaze helplessly at him -- when, suddenly one presses through to the fence, pushing his way past th others, terrified as he tries to keep pace with Caesar; Caesar is overcome by the sight of HIS SHRIEKING SON. Caesar nervously glances at the Colonel, worried he'll notice; he turns back to his son, shaking his head urgent trying to quiet him -- -- when the Colonel starts to turn... Seeing this, Caesar has no choice -- he quickly turns away from his own child HOLD ON CORNELIUS, watching his father walk away --

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR TO THE ADULT APE PEN
dialogues.text: swings open as the group arrives; Caesar peers in at the hordes of prisoners -- The Colonel nods, and Red HURLS Caesar violently to the ground, grabbing his leg HARD and shackling Caesar to the others. Red returns the key to Preacher -- Caesar staring up at t Colonel, who watches an eerie moment longer, then heads o The others follow. TIGHT ON CAESAR; he looks up at the ape prisoners... They stare at him coldly, and then turn their backs on him. Caesar lifts his head, stunned... as ANOTHER GROUP turns away... and ANOTHER. A quiet ape sound makes Caesar turn he finds LAKE in their midst, gazing back consolingly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Forgive them. We've been through much.] Caesar nods, shell-shocked, reeling...   Finally, he spea quietly devastated:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will find some way to get us out of here. I promise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head, grim) [You don't know what this place is like.] The sound of crying makes Caesar turn; he looks at the pe across the way, where little Cornelius is pressed to the bars, helplessly reaching his arm out toward Caesar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Father...!] As Caesar gapes back, heartbroken, guilt-stricken, we CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the camp in the distance, nestled at the foot of t mountains; a dilapidated barrier wall stretches out from front of it in both directions as far as the eye can see.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: TRAVELING OVER THE SLEEPING APES, chained on the icy ground... we hear the sound of DISTANT MARCHING, when a L HUMAN VOICE BEGINS SINGING out hauntingly across the yard a militaristic gospel tone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hu-uh-left... Left-right-left... THE CAMERA ARRIVES AT CAESAR, who stirs, his eyes opening the SINGING CONTINUES. PUSH IN on Caesar, confused, as ap around him start to wake up as well, a palpable anxiety spreading... he looks at Ape Elder who shakes his head, g Caesar turns at the building sound of at least THREE HUND SOLDIERS MARCHING in formation outside the APE PENS; he rises, anxiously scans the rigid faces, intensity burning their eyes as they march past the frightened, caged apes. As the SINGING STOPS, the soldiers abruptly halt, turning about face, eyes fixed upward; Caesar follows the gazes t

dialogues.speaker: THE EMPTY WARDEN'S TOWER BALCONY
dialogues.text: the "A" FLAG waving just below it. Chilled, Caesar watche as the soldiers all hold in fervent SALUTE, and the X.O. cries out, leading a MARINES-STYLE CALL-AND-RESPONSE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are the beginning...!

dialogues.speaker: AND THE END
dialogues.text: Caesar stares, unnerved, as the Soldiers' call-and-respon crescendos in OMINOUS CHANTS OF "OO-RAH!" as they gaze up the tower, where finally... THE COLONEL SLOWLY EMERGES; h shirtless, despite the cold, not fully dressed yet -- he stares down at the assembled troops, casually shaving the back of his head with a straight razor as chants ROAR bel A shrill chorus of ARMY WHISTLES suddenly breaks out -- Caesar quickly turns to see the soldiers moving for the p as the doors unlock, ARMED SOLDIERS enter and Red and the TURNCOATS storm in, forcing the lines of chained apes to their feet and into the yard with WHIPS -- it's terrifyin

dialogues.speaker: THE COLONEL
dialogues.text: watching the brutality; he stops shaving a moment, calmly pulls a FLASK from his hip, and takes a slow drink; then disappears into the tower again.

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR
dialogues.text: MARCHING gravely with hordes of apes across the snowy yar ARMED SOLDIERS pace menacingly atop FUEL TANKER RAILCARS along the side of the camp, keeping watch over the prison Caesar slows, suddenly struck by what's LOOMING up ahead

dialogues.speaker: THE EXTREMELY HIGH BARRIER WALL
dialogues.text: that seals in the front of the camp; it's unlike anything we've ever seen. Part of it is man-made, cracked slabs of weathered concrete erected side by side years ago; but a section, growing right out of the original wall, is ape-m

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Massive tree-trunks have been fastened in a primitive but elaborate framework, into which huge stones are being set one by one. The apes have been rebuilding the crumbling w As Caesar moves closer, his eyes are drawn to an old slab cement, still standing in the midst of the ape constructi On it, "A" is painted in HUGE BLOOD RED GRAFFITI SCRAWL; next to this drip the words: "HUMANITY'S LAST STAND". Caesar stares at the words, chilled... as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar labors, just another slave in the sea of apes pass brutally heavy boulders to be laid into the growing wall, Soldiers keep GUNS trained on them. Caesar squints out at even more apes perched dangerously on the rock shelf abov the tanker cars, quarrying for the stones.
