Beside him, Lake heaves another boulder; Caesar peers pas her at the apes around them; they look WEARY, GAUNT; on t framework above, EXHAUSTED apes -- Ape Elder among them - battle to lift boulders on ropes. Lake sees the anguish o Caesar's face as he takes in the suffering, she signs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We haven't had food or water since we got here...] Stunned, anger fills his face; he glares up at the struct

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Why do they need a wall...?] Lake looks back at him, shaking her head: I don't know -- when Caesar sees -- THE COLONEL arriving at the work site; his Soldiers nervo address him as his eyes roam the wall, surveying the prog -- then fix on Caesar -- when suddenly a SOLDIER CRIES OU

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: The Colonel turns to the commotion -- Caesar turns too -- find Ape Elder struggling high up on the framework, dizzy with fatigue, losing grip on his rope as Soldiers and Turncoat Apes watch with alarm from below -- -- when he COLLAPSES, the rope ripping from his fingers - the rock CRASHES into the framing, KNOCKING DOWN a big section of the stone wall in a violent chain reaction!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Furious, Boyle spins to one of the Turncoats -- Red. Caes watches as he orders Red to punish Ape Elder; Red and the other turncoats pull the feeble ape from the rubble and d him into the yard, in full sight of the Colonel, where Re dutifully begins to WHIP the old ape...! Startled, Caesar looks at the Colonel, who watches the beating, unmoved -- then back to the helpless old chimp -

dialogues.speaker: ON CAESAR
dialogues.text: as he steps slowly forward in horror, pained by the excruciating sight -- the apes in his line follow, affect too... Caesar pulls himself up onto one of the tree trunk in the framework, stepping into a CLOSE UP, his rage star to boil... until finally, unable to bear it, he ERUPTS:

dialogues.speaker: LEAVE HIM
dialogues.text: Heads turn, everyone stopping dead in their tracks as CAESAR'S BOOMING VOICE ECHOES across the yard... Even Red goes still, turning with the others to SEE --

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR UP ON THE FRAMEWORK
dialogues.text: GLARING back defiantly; then, he turns slowly to the Colo fury in his eyes, no concern for his own safety... For a moment, the yard is suspended in TOTAL SILENCE as Caesar and the Colonel lock eyes -- when, one by one, the APES START TO CHANT... Low and guttural at first... then RISING INTO A DEAFENING CHORUS OF REBELLIOUS HOOTS AND SHRIEKS -- as they defiant DROP THE STONES AND TOOLS to the ground! Surprised, Caesar turns... stunned by what he has started he peers around at the apes, to find them all gazing at h in solidarity as they chant... CLOSE ON APE ELDER still on his knees, clutching his woun watching in awe as the protest reaches a fever pitch... The Soldiers are at a loss as to how to restore order -- turn to the Colonel who just stares ominously at Caesar.. Eyes fearfully on the Colonel, a SOLDIER FRANTICALLY GEST across the chaos to Red and the Turncoats: get him!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: turns as Turncoats and Soldiers approach (Preacher among them); unafraid, Caesar steps down to meet them -- his ch gang CHANTING protectively -- when the Turncoats GRAB Cae The Soldiers anxiously hold the others in check with thei weapons -- as the roar of the crowd grows even LOUDER -- Caesar glares as Preacher nervously unclips his keys from belt, tosses them to Red, who unshackles him...

dialogues.speaker: THE COLONEL
dialogues.text: watches as Caesar is marched into the yard, and thrust on his knees beside Ape Elder. The Colonel considers Caesar; then, eyes still on him, gestures calmly to the Turncoats The Turncoats tighten their grip on Caesar's arms -- and suddenly WHIPS Caesar's back with a VICIOUS SNAP! The APES' CHANTING SUDDENLY FALTERS as -- Caesar WINCES -- but he refuses to break eye-contact with Colonel, who stares back, a battle of wills... The Colonel nods; and Red LASHES Caesar again! Spirits broken, the apes go SILENT; beside Caesar, Ape El drops his eyes. Red looks to the Colonel, lowering his switch -- but the Colonel's eyes remain fixed on Caesar's, the two leaders staring at each other, neither giving in... And then the Colonel NODS to Red again. Surprised, Red hesitates -- then, LASHES Caesar once more, the CRACK ech through the silent camp. The Colonel coldly nods again; e Red is shaken by the Colonel's relentlessness. Red slowly lifts his whip again -- and -- WHAP! Caesar finally DROPS HIS HEAD, broken by the pain. GASPS ripple through the apes. The Colonel nods to the Turncoats, who release Caesar; he crumples to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ok.   Back to work. The SOLDIERS YELL for the apes to get back to work; but t apes just stare at Caesar, worried, as he lies on the gro Caesar finally lifts his head, his face now smeared in MU he looks at the apes, then glowers back at the Colonel, fiercely gritting his teeth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apes need food. Water. The Colonel glances at the apes, then back at Caesar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.    Tell them to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simmering) Give them food and wat-- -- without   warning the Colonel suddenly pulls his sidea shoots Ape   Elder dead right beside Caesar, then immedia places the   gun against Caesar's temple -- the speed and efficiency   of the action is utterly chilling. Caesar gapes in shock as terror ripples through the apes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an eerie calm) Tell them. Caesar stares silently at him, unflinching, trembling wit rage -- as the Colonel SLOWLY COUNTS DOWN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five...    Four... He tightens his finger on the trigger; but Caesar remains stoic, willing to die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three...   Two... And suddenly an APE by the wall quickly reaches out and p up one of the boulders, desperate to save Caesar's life - It's LAKE. The Colonel pauses at the sight, gun still raised... Caesar turns to see her, surprised... And then ANOTHER APE picks up a boulder. Then another... Caesar watches, distraught, as more and more apes pick up stones and tools. The Colonel finally lowers his gun. Caesar glares back at him bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Red) String him up, donkey. And the Colonel heads off; Preacher stares down at Caesar with pity as Red moves in... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR BEING TIED TO AN X
dialogues.text: The X has been erected atop a platform on the tracks in t center of the yard, for all to see; Red binds him up as Preacher stands guard... As the POV starts to drop, REVEA

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Lowering the binoculars, in utter shock; lying beside him Rocket and Bad Ape, eyes glued to his expression. Maurice hands Rocket the binoculars to see for himself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warning them, fearful) Bad place... But the apes ignore him. He turns to the Girl on Maurice' back, looking for anyone who'll listen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad, bad place. She just stares at him, blank-faced. Peering through the glasses, Rocket makes a low anguished grunt. Bad Ape turns anxiously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    What you see...?

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Rocket sees Caesar on the X, face covered in mud; the POV WHIPS to the MASSES OF CHAINED APES at the wall. ROCKET sets the glasses down, turns to Maurice, overwhelm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Must save them! But how?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Must think! What would Caesar do?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! They look over to see Bad Ape squinting into the binocula

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) Why so small?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He lowers the glasses to look at them, appalled. They jus stare at him. Then Rocket reaches out and flips the binoculars the right way around, hands them back. Bad Ape looks at him, confused. He peers through again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally seeing the crisis below)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Red finishes roughly binding Caesar, who looks haggard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright -- that's good. Red turns. Preacher jerks his head: go. Red takes a last menacing look at Caesar, then starts down the platform. Preacher watches him go... then turns back to Caesar; he hesitates... then lowers his voice, hurriedly confidin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I owe you one, so let me set you straight here, ok? I think he respects you, he does... that's why you're still alive. But believe me, he can do a lot worse than this. I've seen it. (haunted, almost a whisper) You do not want to agitate the man. Understand? So just... He gestures with his hand: back off. Disturbed, Caesar ho his gaze; then watches as Preacher descends the platform.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND CAESAR HANGING LIMPLY ON THE X
dialogues.text: We're looking out past Caesar over the camp, as exhausted apes are herded away from the wall, the work day over... diesel GENERATOR COUGHS to life, HARSH LIGHTS blinking on Caesar squints into the glare, weary -- when the SOUND OF SOLDIERS makes him look below -- at a group approaching f the rear of the camp, rolling ominous-looking ARTILLERY; suddenly concerned, he watches them head toward the apes. ...the fraught apes look alarmed as they see the weapons Soldiers coming their way -- then Caesar discovers even m Soldiers with MASSIVE MACHINE GUNS by the wall. Unnerved, sees them hoisting the guns up to the sentry towers... wh others position them on tripods; but then Caesar NOTICES

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: All the weapons are POINTED OUTWARD, BEYOND THE CAMP... Caesar is relieved; he stares at the weapons, perplexed - when he hears FOOTSTEPS; he turns to see -- RED climbing the platform toward him, gripping a long MAC with a look of cruel satisfaction... Startled, Caesar tenses; he peers around anxiously to FIND -- THE COLONEL eerily watching from the warden tower window. Chilled, Caesar turns back, bracing for the worst, as Red stops before him... He looks at the knife, then meets Red cold gaze. Steeling himself, he hardens, his voice hoarse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did the Colonel promise you? You really think he will let you live... after we are gone? Red just stares, contempt in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what you do... you'll never be one of them. (then) You let them call you "donkey"... You are ape. Red raises his knife, examining it in his hands; he runs fingers along the edge... Then looks at Caesar, sneers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koba right. You think you know better... than rest of apes. But look you now. (his expression darkens) You nothing. Red SUDDENLY LIFTS THE MACHETE -- Caesar's eyes widen as

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE WOOD, AN INCH FROM CAESAR'S WRIST, HACKING THROU
dialogues.text: THE ROPE -- ! Caesar turns to Red in shock, as his arm is set free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacing, quiet) Kerna... want see you. Caesar looks back up at the tower window where the Colone remains staring a moment longer; then turns, and disappea

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: Then a DOOR IS OPENED, REVEALING -- we are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel stands with his back to us, leaning on a map- covered table in the former window-lined control center, smoke rises from sage and grass smudge burning in a tin b

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR, PREACHER AND RED ENTER
dialogues.text: approaching the Colonel, who still doesn't acknowledge th as searchlights outside sweep through, Caesar catches a b glimpse of a room just off the control center -- it looks almost like a sanctum; light passes over APE SKULLS... th word "HISTORY" scrawled on a wall... then the room goes d again. Caesar looks unsettled -- his gaze returning to th Colonel, and noticing for the first time painful looking BRAND SCARS on the back of his hands: one Alpha, one Omeg The Colonel finally speaks, eyes still on the map: THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interfere with the work again, and I'll begin slaughtering the apes, one by one. Understand? I need that wall. He looks up coldly at Caesar, then nods at Preacher: that all -- they start to lead Caesar out, but he won't go yet CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apes... need food... water. THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on the map) They'll get food and water when they finish the work. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give them food and water... or they will not be able to finish. The Colonel looks up, amused by Caesar's audacity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you're very emotional. (then) What makes you think you're in a position to make demands? Caesar doesn't reply. The Colonel turns back to the map - Preacher nervously tugs again on Caesar's chain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- But Caesar stands firm, eyes fixed on the Colonel:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers who are coming here... are not coming to join you, are they? The Colonel slowly looks up, smiles, suddenly intrigued - Red warily tightens his grip on Caesar's chain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw men outside by the wall... preparing for battle... The Colonel studies him, surprised:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was told you were smart, but... that's impressive. He stares at Caesar a moment; then finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   They won't be joining me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are against you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They... fear me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why...? The Colonel just looks at him, silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you kill your own men? Preacher tenses; The Colonel holds Caesar's gaze, stunned

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found bodies. (then) Something wrong... with these men. The Colonel shakes his head in awe:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... you are impressive. (then, almost enjoying this)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you paint quite a picture.     What you must think of me. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... you have no mercy. The Colonel goes still, a deep nerve struck.    He DARKEN THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came here to kill me.   Were you going to show me mercy? CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I showed you mercy... when I spared your men. I offered you peace. And you killed my family. THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, with contempt) Mercy. Do you have any idea what your mercy would do to us? Caesar stares warily, confused by the simmering rage he s to have provoked in the Colonel. THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're much stronger than we are. And you're smart as hell. No matter what you say, you'd eventually replace us, that's the law of Nature. The irony is, we created you. We tried to defy Nature, bend it to our will. And Nature's been punishing us for our arrogance ever since. Testing us. Even now. Caesar searches the Colonel's ominous expression...     T THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten months ago, we sent out recon units to look for your base. They found nothing. My own son was a soldier with one of the groups. One day he suddenly stopped speaking. He became... primitive. Like an animal. They contacted me, said they thought he lost his mind, that the war was too much for him. But then the man caring for him stopped speaking too. Their medic had a theory, before he stopped speaking. That the virus that almost wiped us out -- the virus every human survivor still carries В­- had suddenly changed... Mutated. (peers at Caesar) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if it spread, it would destroy humanity for good this time. Not by killing us... but by robbing us of the things that make us human. Our speech, our higher thinking... It would turn us into beasts... not unlike what you all used to be. You talk about mercy...? What would you have done? Caesar stares back, unnerved, challenged... he has no ans THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was a moment of clarity for me. I realized I would have to sacrifice my only son, so that humanity could be saved. I held that gun in my hand, and I pointed it at my only child. (emotion in his eyes as he remembers) He looked at me with trust in his eyes, all he had left in his primitive gaze. And I pulled the trigger. It purified me. It made my purpose clear. His eyes finally return to Caesar's, who looks stunned. THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave orders to kill the other infected, all of them, and anyone who might've been in direct contact, even if they showed no symptoms. We burned their belongings, anything that might spread contamination. Some of the men questioned my judgment. I was asking them to do what I had done: to sacrifice their families... their friends. They refused. So I had them killed too. (growing darker) Others with children deserted into the woods. One of those cowards fled to my superiors up north. They sent officers down to restrain me. They tried to convince me this plague could be dealt with medically, that up there they were already looking for a cure. That's when I realized: they had learned nothing from our past. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harrowed) You killed them too...?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do, Preacher? PREACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, quietly) You severed their heads, sir. THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for the one I spared, so he could return to deliver a message: if they wanted to relieve me of my command, they'd have to meet me here, and do it themselves. Caesar stares, his eyes questioning what the Colonel mean THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place used to be a weapons depot. They turned it into a relocation camp when the crisis was just beginning. But the weapons are all still here, inside that mountain. (a beat) This is a holy war. All of human history has led to this moment. And if we lose, we'll be the last of our kind. It will be a planet of apes. And we'll become your cattle. Caesar just stares, unsettled; they hold each other's eye THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. You think I'm sick, don't you. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many... will be coming? THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably all of them. Don't get any ideas -- only thing they fear more than me is you apes. They never questioned my methods when it came to you. He moves closer, looking at Caesar's face, his tone quiet THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to kill your son... Caesar remains totally still as the Colonel studies him.. The Colonel's nearness is almost too much to bear...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in even closer) But if his destiny was to inherit your unholy kingdom... then I'm glad I did. A sudden rage surges behind Caesar's eyes -- HE LUNGES -- The Colonel LEAPS BACKWARD -- Caesar's fingers GROPING FO HIS THROAT as he SCRAMBLES out of reach JUST IN TIME -- R

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY SEIZES CAESAR'S CHAIN
dialogues.text: The Colonel HITS the floor, FLASK tumbling from his jacke Panicked, FURIOUSLY LEVELS HIS CROSSBOW -- SCREAMING -- PREACHER

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: CAESAR SEETHES, raging in vain against the restraint -- In shock, the Colonel gathers himself, picks up the flask self-consciously pocketing it as he stands, backing away he touches the side of his neck to find Caesar nicked him He looks at the BLOOD on his fingers with a rush, smiling breathlessly as Caesar strains, CHOKING in Red's grasp: THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So emotional! The Colonel watches, smile fading as Caesar finally relen THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see how conflicted you are. You're confused in your purpose. You're angry at me because of something I did that was an act of war. But you're taking this all much too personally. Preacher watches as The Colonel steps forward, venturing closer to Caesar, seemingly unconcerned for his safety... PREACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sir -- The Colonel holds up his hand to silence Preacher as he s right in front of Caesar again, eye to eye... Caesar burn tortured by the agonizing effort to restrain his rage... THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think my men would've done to your apes... if you had killed me? Caesar looks up at the Colonel. The Colonel holds Caesar' angry stare as he starts slowly forward:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or is killing me more important...? The Colonel lingers tauntingly... finally, he turns to Preacher -- and as Preacher and Red move in, we --

dialogues.speaker: PREACHER AND RED MARCHING CAESAR OUT OF THE DEPOT
dialogues.text: They head for the yard -- Preacher utters quietly, shaken PREACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I tell you not to agitate him? That was not smart, man... Caesar glances at Preacher, then at Red behind them; he t forward, speaks softly to Preacher, a hint of sympathy: CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this battle is coming... you should leave, while you still can. Preacher turns to him; then abruptly stops:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave?     What are you talking about? CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not like him. Preacher looks at Caesar, taken aback -- maybe even offen PREACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was right, you do think he's sick, don't you? You're just like them. He's not crazy. The world's gone crazy. And he's the only one with the vision to get us through this. The Colonel's a great man. He sacrificed everything for us. You can't judge him. Who are you to judge him? (darkening) I was trying to give you a heads up, keep you out of his way, I don't even know why. But if you think you and I have some kind of relationship -- that you're gonna give me, what, advice? You can disavow yourself of that notion right fucking now. Caesar is stunned.    Preacher raises his crossbow:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, kong. He glances back, nodding to Red O.S., and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow drifts down around them as they march Caesar through yard, past the soldiers' barracks, LIGHTS inside GOING OU one by one... REVEAL --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CLIFFS JUST ABOVE THE CAMP
dialogues.text: Concealed behind boulders, Rocket LOWERING THE BINOCULARS gravely SCOPING OUT the camp -- as Maurice, the Girl on h back, and Bad Ape arrive next to him, climbing down rocks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) [How is he?] Rocket shakes his head: not good. He rises, waves for the to follow him further down the mountain. They start to go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar waits grimly at the base of the platform, as Red unshackles his hands; Preacher stands guard, the X loomin Caesar looks up to discover APES gathered at the bars of their pen, unseen by Red and Preacher, whose backs are to them. Their starved faces are etched with worry for Caesa He softens, eyes settling on Lake's gentle gaze as Red continues to unshackle him. Concern fills Lake's eyes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You look weary.] Caesar looks back at her, then peers out at the MASS OF DISPIRITED APE FACES. Determination sets in; he steals a look at his captors, then signs discreetly to the apes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Do not lose hope... Some way, somehow, we will finish the journey to our new home. I will find a way to get us out of here.] The Apes return moved stares -- when Red hands Preacher b the key, and Preacher nods for Caesar to climb the platfo

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lake and the others watch as Caesar, weakened, takes an exhausted step -- and suddenly STUMBLES, knocking into Preacher -- who shoves him back, startled --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off! The Apes look scared for Caesar as Red yanks him down. Recovering, Caesar lifts his head, glancing meaningfully at Lake, then rises to his feet... Confused, Lake watches as Caesar continues up the steps - when she notices CAESAR'S HAND slipping behind his back - the hand subtly opens, Lake suddenly SEES Caesar is caref showing her something -- Preacher's shackle key is now concealed in Caesar's palm, small key ring looped slyly around his middle finger. Lake can't believe her eyes; with dawning hope she turns, points it out to the others -- their eyes widen, exciteme spreading as they watch him ascend the platform...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket leads as the group sneaks along the base of the wa They arrive at a spot where the wall has come down, steal look around the edge, peering into the camp... ...to see the apes in their pens, Caesar on the X, and between here and there, SOLDIERS on duty -- -- when suddenly they hear the sound of HOOVES approachin as a SOLDIER ON HORSEBACK exits the front gate on patrol, heading their way -- ! Panicked, THEY DASH ACROSS THE EXPANSE, heading for an OUTCROPPING OF LARGE ROCKS a hundred feet from the wall -

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE ROCKS
dialogues.text: The group quickly climbs up, ducking for cover. Rocket an Maurice urgently confer, peeking out from behind the rock the camp in the distance:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [How will we get in?   Humans everywhere.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (undeterred) [Must get in somehow...]

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On pins and needles, Bad Ape watches them raptly, trying interpret their sign language; he sees the repeated two- finger-pointing sign for "get in", and the implication worries him -- he anxiously taps Maurice on the shoulder As Maurice turns, Bad Ape tentatively MIMICS THE "GET IN" SIGN, pointing with his two fingers at the camp:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "In"...?   "In"? Maurice NODS.    Bad Ape is immediately alarmed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- no go in -- ! But they ignore him -- Bad Ape persists with panic, shrin away from them as he pleads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends!   Friends! No go in -- no go iiii-- Without warning he ABRUPTLY DROPS STRAIGHT OUT OF SIGHT, disappearing into the ground as it gives way underneath h Everyone turns, shocked to see him gone. They scramble to where he just vanished -- surprised to find him hanging b his fingertips on the lip of a VERY DEEP HOLE! Rocket reaches down, grasps his forearm, pulling him out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overcome with gratitude) Thank you, friend -- thank you -- But Rocket ignores him, SEEING SOMETHING in the hole. Rocket gestures to Maurice, who looks down to DISCOVER... AN OLD ROPE LADDER staked into one of the dirt sides of t hole, disappearing into the void below. Maurice and Rocket share an intense look, intrigued...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON CAESAR'S HAND, BOUND TO THE X -- we glimpse the still grasped in his partially open fingers -- when ARMY WHISTLES shriek through the yard; the fingers stir as we

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REVEAL Caesar rousing from sleep; he looks frail, almost faint -- his treatment and starvation taking its toll. He peers around, sees the apes being CORRALLED from their pe He watches as the FIGURE OF THE COLONEL appears at the Wa Tower window; The Colonel looks down at a SOLDIER awaitin his command. The Colonel nods; the Soldier SIGNALS and -- TROOPS step forward with WHEELBARROWS and HEAVY PAILS. Caesar watches confused as the troops spread among the ap scooping out HORSE-FEED and setting down PAILS of WATER. The apes glance at each other, unsure... when one of them nervously HOLDS OUT HIS HANDS -- A Soldier dumps a mound of the dry grain into his palms, the starving ape immediately SCARFS IT DOWN. The other starving apes instantly rush forward with CUPPE HANDS -- as others begin to lift pails, DRINKING THIRSTIL AT THE PENS, Lake watches amazed. She looks up AT US, growing emotional, filled with gratit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You saved our lives...]

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON CAESAR
dialogues.text: Stunned. He turns to see Red ascending the platform with pail of water. Red pauses before Caesar, turning to The Colonel, who watches, motionless. Red turns back, raising the water pail to Caesar's parched mouth. Still at a loss Caesar stares at him mistrustfully, but his ravaged body craves sustenance... Finally he parts his lips -- But Red just POURS THE WATER OUT in front of his face, DUMPING IT onto the platform. Caesar hardens, his bloodshot eyes glaring at Red. He tur to look up at The Colonel, who stands there, still motionless... then steps away, disappearing from view.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK.
dialogues.text: With the SOUND OF DIGGING, a THIN BEAM OF LIGHT streaks o at us through the darkness as STONES TUMBLE FREE; we are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice holds the scavenged flashlight as he and Rocket finish clearing RUBBLE; behind them a length of narrow tu recedes. They look around at the area they've cleared...

dialogues.speaker: SEE --
dialogues.text: SEWAGE TUNNELS leading into darkness. The walls are COVER IN FADED GRAFFITI. In huge, desperate scrawl they see: "T WAY OUT!!!" alongside a spray-painted arrow pointing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Rocket) [Sick humans must have tried to escape underground!] Rocket nods and as they start to explore deeper, we CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the two apes and the light from their flashlight s to shrink from view -- REVEAL --

dialogues.speaker: BAD APE
dialogues.text: watching from the mouth of the tunnel in the hole they fo last night. He gazes anxiously as they disappear -- when We hear SHRILL, DISTANT WHISTLES blowing -- Bad Ape turns see -- THE GIRL CLIMBING the rope ladder toward the sound Bad Ape rushes to the ladder, calling up to her, alarmed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no -- no climb -- ! But she continues, climbing out the top... Bad Ape clutch his head, torn about what to do; then reluctantly starts

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TOP OF THE HOLE
dialogues.text: Bad Ape pokes his head up... to find the Girl heading awa

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GIRL
dialogues.text: as she heads toward the edge of the rocks, drawn by somet she sees in the distance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no!   Where you go?!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He appears, running after her.. He finds her SQUINTING ou something past the rocks... He follows her stare to ONE O THE OPENINGS in the massive wall. He whispers to her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   What you see...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice and Rocket head down the tunnel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Must be under the camp by now!] They stop in a cavernous concrete hub where the sewage tunnels converge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Wonder how close we are... to where soldiers keep apes?] He lifts his flashlight to the ceiling; they both look up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apes work on the wall in the distance, some HOISTING heav 12 ROCKET LAUNCHERS into place above -- when -- we HEAR a QUIET RUSTLING sound -- which continues as we PULL FOCUS the train rail in front of us, and begin PUSHING TOWARD I As we clear over the rail, we TIP DOWN to see the BALLAST GRAVEL under the tracks STARTING TO MOVE... The stones SHUDDER, and suddenly begin to FUNNEL DOWNWARD as we CUT

dialogues.speaker: THE TUNNEL BELOW
dialogues.text: where a RUSH OF GRAVEL showers over Rocket, who stands on Maurice's back as Rocket claws through the earth above th DAYLIGHT suddenly peeks in through a TINY HOLE in the surface. Rocket stops digging; he glances down at Maurice then carefully presses his eye to the hole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peering up through the train tracks we can see A TALL MET POLE looming against the winter sky. As we --

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMP ABOVE
dialogues.text: The pole is revealed to be a TRAIN SIGNAL SWITCH rising i exposed area of the yard, Soldiers nearby on either side.

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR
dialogues.text: He is covered in frost and ice, shivering with hypothermi very near death... BAD APE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly distraught) Ohhhh no, friend...

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL BAD APE
dialogues.text: lowering the binoculars -- he turns to the girl to share bad news --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He -- when he sees

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRL
dialogues.text: already starting to walk away toward the camp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent whisper) No! He creeps out from behind the rocks after her    -- FRANT

dialogues.speaker: WHISPERING
dialogues.text: BAD APE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no... no no no... She pauses, peering up for a moment at the immense wall. Then she looks back over her shoulder at Bad Ape -- he WA FOR HER TO COME BACK, NODDING desperately...

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR ON THE X
dialogues.text: His head bowed, fading even more now, shaking, his lips cracked, his skin frostbitten and turning blue. He looks if he might die any second... It is eerily quiet now.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A SHADOW passes over him... And then, a PAIR OF APE HANDS reach slowly into frame, gently cradling Caesar's face... CAESAR'S EYES FLUTTER OPEN, struggling to see; he looks u the Ape, its face OUT OF FOCUS, haloed by the camp's ligh As the Ape's head nears, blocking the light, its face com into view: it is KOBA, staring down at Caesar tenderly. Caesar's eyes widen, bewildered; he's breathless:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koba... Koba leans in toward Caesar, gazing into his eyes... then moves even closer, pressing his lips to Caesar's ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a comforting whisper) Sleep... Fighting exhaustion, Caesar pulls back, struggling to res

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go... (glances toward the apes) You cannot save them... They will all die here... Caesar follows his gaze, then looks back at Koba, stricke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...    Join me... Caesar starts to shut his eyes, devastated -- when a BLIN FLASH startles him -- he squints back up as a MACHETE swi through the air overhead -- the blade HACKS into the rope binding his wrist with a LOUD THWACK! Completely disoriented, Caesar looks back at the Ape besi him again, realizing now it is RED. He looks past him to The Colonel and Preacher too -- as Red cuts the rope arou his other hand, Caesar finally COLLAPSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's still alive in the morning, he goes back to work or you shoot him. (then) Keep him separate from the others.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Preacher nods; as Caesar sees Red moving for him, he uses last bit of strength to close his fist around the key...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket and Maurice clamber urgently out behind Bad Ape, w stops at the edge of the rocks -- pointing frantically wi two fingers again and again at the opening in the barrier wall -- trying to sign:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN!     She go IN! Stunned, Maurice and Rocket slowly turn to the camp; and

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL
dialogues.text: As Soldiers work busily in the towers and all along the w securing artillery -- we see the Girl walking right throu the open front gate directly below, totally unnoticed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSHING SLOWLY IN on Caesar through the bars... He lies on his stomach, face to the ground. As the CAMERA stops, a small blurry FORM steps to the edge of frame...

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL THE GIRL
dialogues.text: Standing in front of the cage, staring down at Caesar sad After a moment, she fishes into the pocket of her bulky parka, and pulls out her RAG DOLL. She stretches her arm through the bars, straining toward Caesar... GENTLY TOSSI the doll toward him. Dazed, Caesar slowly lifts his head, confused... and discovers the doll next to him on the ground. He looks up... to see the Girl staring down with concern. She holds his gaze; then lifts her tiny hand and tentativ slides her finger along her neck -- the sign Maurice was trying to teach her for: THE GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Thirsty...?] Caesar looks at her, stunned.    And touched.   And then

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Girl abruptly turns and walks off. Caesar cranes his head, worried for her... unable to see where she's gone.. when she suddenly returns, lugging a pail of water in bot hands. She raises the pail, holds it to the bars. Caesar lifts himself, pressing his face to the bars... an she tilts the pail, gently spilling water into his mouth. Caesar thirstily guzzles, the Girl removes one hand from pail, touching the side of his face -- QUIET APE GRUNTS echo from the yard.   The Girl turns to A LARGE GROUP OF APES pressed to the bars of their pen, watching her and Caesar. A few silently wave her over...

dialogues.speaker: THE YARD
dialogues.text: As the Girl crosses from Caesar's cage to the Apes' pen, oblivious to the potential danger around her... REVEAL:

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE, ROCKET, AND BAD APE
dialogues.text: watching anxiously, their three faces huddled together in shadows, peering around the edge of the giant front gate.

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR
dialogues.text: gazing nervously through the bars at the Girl, who stands the Apes' pen, her back to us; she seems engaged in some transaction with them, the Apes all trying to get near he Caesar's eyes dart tensely around at GUARDS ON PATROL in distance, unaware of her presence, but for how long...? Finally, the Girl turns and heads toward Caesar, CRADLING SOMETHING IN HER ARMS. Caesar watches curiously as she st up to his cage. He glances at the APES IN THEIR PEN to fi them all watching expectantly... Caesar turns back to the Girl; she leans forward carefull as if about to spill the contents from her arms -- puzzle Caesar reaches his hands out to catch whatever it is -- AND A LONG STREAM OF GRAIN RUSHES INTO HIS PALMS. Surprised, Caesar looks up at her... then out at the Apes the pen, their eyes all still on him. One of them raises hands, quietly pressing his fists together, SIGNING proud

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Apes together strong.] A wave of emotion floods Caesar's face; and then he sees other Apes silently raising their fists too... Caesar is completely overcome as each and every one of them joins i A smile slowly surfaces on Caesar's face; you can almost his strength returning... The Girl follows Caesar's gaze to the Apes and their up- stretched hands; then turns back to Caesar. She uncertain raises her fists together too... smiling, proud of hersel

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE, ROCKET, AND BAD APE
dialogues.text: watch from behind the gate, affected by the sight -- when they spot something the apes and the Girl cannot yet see

dialogues.speaker: THE COLONEL AND SOME OF THE OFFICERS IN THE DISTANCE
dialogues.text: deep in conference, walking in the direction of the pens. MAURICE AND ROCKET exchange terrified looks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [If humans see her, they will kill her...]

dialogues.speaker: ON CAESAR AND THE GIRL
dialogues.text: as they SPIN, startled -- suddenly seeing the Colonel and troops stepping into view ten feet away -- when -- a sudd COMMOTION in the distance grabs their attention -- Caesar grunts urgently to the Girl, nodding for her to hi she presses quickly behind one of the guard tower legs -- just as the Colonel and troops stop in the path right bef Caesar's cage, still gazing off at the disturbance... Caesar follows their looks to SEE -- A SQUAD OF FIVE SOLDIERS, guns-drawn, amped up, shouting AN UNSEEN INTRUDER... As they approach, prodding with the weapons, Caesar discovers the intruder is -- ROCKET.   He marches slowly, chin-raised defiantly. Caesar watches in shock as Rocket is brought toward the waiting Colonel... who slowly turns and looks suspiciousl Caesar -- unaware of the Girl just behind the tower leg..

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Rocket arrives at gunpoint, the Colonel gestures to Re Red and Rocket exchange hard stares; Red moves to restrai Rocket's arms -- but ROCKET SUDDENLY RESISTS, thrashing i Red, HEAD-BUTTING HIM -- Red stumbles, clutching his head stunned... then LAUNCHES furiously back at Rocket! The two apes begin VICIOUSLY WRESTLING as the SOLDIERS WA guns trained; a few LAUGH derisively, amused by the displ TWO TURNCOATS nervously approach, unsure what to do -- Caesar seizes this momentary distraction -- gestures for Girl to make a run for it -- SHE DARTS AWAY -- ducking be the long barracks nearby, streaking toward the wall -- The Colonel peers down annoyed at Red and Rocket; he calm pulls out his sidearm, points down at them and FIRES -- ! Caesar's head whips around -- as Rocket and Red FREEZE, startled -- a CLOUD OF DIRT kicking up from where the bul hit the ground beside them... Red immediately takes the opportunity to get the upper ha forcing Rocket's face to the ground, pinning him. The Colonel walks closer to Rocket; stares at him a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many are out there?   Are there others? Rocket stays silent, refusing to show even a hint of fear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Soldiers) Sweep the area. (turns to Red) Put him in the pen. As the Colonel walks off, Red abruptly leaps to his feet, grabbing Rocket by the ankle -- Rocket FLAILS VIOLENTLY a Red drags him across the dirt and ice... Caesar watches in horror as the turncoats move in, BEATIN ROCKET into submission as they HURL him into the pen. One roughly SHACKLES HIM -- as Red delivers a last, VICIOUS K leaving Rocket in a crumpled heap as they exit. Caesar's stricken eyes remain fixed on Rocket as he strug to his feet. His face bloodied and bruised, Rocket looks back at Caesar through the bars of their pens -- and to Caesar's surprise, Rocket smiles at him... He SIGNS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Feeling better?]

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Thrown, Caesar looks at him, then manages a slight smile; nods. Rocket nods back, pleased: ROCKET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Good.   Then we can talk about escape.] He brings his fists together: "Apes together strong." Emotional, Caesar smiles, proud of his friend; as he brin his own fists together... PRE-LAP -- A LONE HUMAN VOICE SINGING OUT in gospel tones EXECUTIVE OFFICER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hu-uh-left... Left-right-left...

dialogues.speaker: PRISON CAMP
dialogues.text: The SOLDIERS MARCH in formation toward the Warden's Tower as the Apes peer anxiously through the bars of their pens The procession comes to a halt, all eyes lifting expectan to the Colonel's balcony, waiting for him to appear... wh the SOUND OF A METAL DOOR suddenly scrapes open -- everyo turns, surprised to see -- THE COLONEL emerging at the base of   the tower, right be them. He's in FORMAL DRESS GREENS,    MEDALS on his chest BERET on his head. He moves to the    top of the steps, l out, studying their uncertain faces   a pregnant moment.. ON CAESAR, observing from his cage -- his eyes flit waril Rocket's across the way -- then back to the Colonel... as finally begins to address his assembled troops; there is something momentous, almost reflective in his tone: THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For two years we've fought relentlessly against these beasts, and when we are done with them, we will bring an end to their kind. But now we find ourselves on the eve of battle... against our own kind. So you may ask: who is the real enemy, who are we fighting here? And I'll tell you. It's not the apes. It's not the men who are on their way here right now to altercate with us. The battle we've been waging all this time is against ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He watches them as the words sink in, then starts down th steps, walking among them as he continues -- his eyes dar momentarily across the yard, meeting Caesar's:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say we are inhumane. Indecent. They call us a death squad. But they'll never understand the extent of our sacrifice. How agonizing it has been to do what must be done, even as it tears at our very souls. Because there are times when you must abandon your humanity in the fight to save humanity. All of you have shown the courage to do that... But now we must take that fight to them, or this hellish trial will all have been in vain. (beat, still walking through the ranks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can not fail. We're the last defense. Somewhere in this world there are more survivors. And whether they know it or not, they are counting on us. To show the will to protect them against this new plague. We've seen it here. And it's already spreading up north. If we lose this battle, there'll be nothing to stop it from spreading everywhere. If we lose, in a matter of months, the human race will gasp its last words, and go silent. Just another dumb animal, left to roam a godforsaken world. He comes to a stop in the Soldier's midst -- Preacher clo by, gazing intently -- the Colonel's tone growing intimat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of you are still young men and women. And if we win, years from now, you may be sitting somewhere with your children, your grandchildren... and they'll ask you: what did you do in the greatest war...? And you can tell them, you fought... viciously... for a gentler world. Preacher looks almost emotional -- the others too -- as t Colonel NODS to the X.O. -- and as WHISTLES SHRIEK -- we:

dialogues.speaker: THE APE PENS
dialogues.text: CRANE over the apes being forced out into the yard... FINDING the Colonel now wading through the chaos, Preache and Red at his side... as they ARRIVE at CAESAR'S CAGE. The Colonel pulls out his sidearm, nods to Preacher who unlocks the cage, opens the door... they all stare in at CAESAR, who returns a hard, weary look, making no motion exit -- when CH-CHINK -- the Colonel cocks his gun. Caesar hesitates, then gathers the strength to stand, and slowly steps out of the cage. The Colonel stares at him, hard: THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send him up to the quarry.    Alone. Red fastens shackles to Caesar's ankles and wrists, and l at Preacher, who is searching through his key rings -- he can't find the shackle key; suddenly nervous, his eyes da to the Colonel, as he continues searching in vain... Impatient, the Colonel calls out to Boyle who's passing b with the first groups of chained apes -- THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyle!   His cuffs. Boyle heads over, starts to lock Caesar up -- when the Colonel suddenly sees something... Caesar watches as the Colonel steps toward the cage, reaches in... and retrieve THE GIRL'S DOLL. He stares at it, perplexed: THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Caesar) What is this...? But Caesar is silent.   The Colonel turns to Preacher -- THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did this get in there? Preacher shakes his head, looking pale: PREACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't know, sir... The Colonel looks back hard at Caesar; then, finally: THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him to work.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Colonel's stare lingers on Caesar as Red shoves him forward; then the Colonel returns his attention to -- THE RAG DOLL IN HIS HANDS... looking eerily up at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar labors alone on a dangerously narrow perch, quarry for heavy stones high above the yard... He looks down as works, secretly scanning the yard, to FIND --

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: waiting to be brought out of the pen, chained to a group other apes; he glances surreptitiously up at Caesar -- Ro NODS -- as Rocket's group is ordered out -- CAESAR WATCHES for a moment as Rocket's group heads towar the wall -- then he turns quickly to FIND --

dialogues.speaker: LAKE
dialogues.text: also looking up at Caesar, waiting with her group by the CHILDREN'S PEN, picking up tools -- she NODS -- and sudde her group moves out toward the wall too --

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR
dialogues.text: turns quickly back to Rocket, whose eyes are fixed on his feet, COUNTING EACH STEP as his group approaches... ...THE TRAIN SIGNAL SWITCH in the middle of the yard -- t spot where he and Maurice dug up from the tunnel below... he passes it, Rocket looks up at Caesar -- stealthily sig ROCKET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar NODS. Then quickly turns back to Lake -- as she to passes the train switch -- she looks up from her feet -- signs to Caesar: LAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar NODS -- and immediately begins to climb, pulling himself up to a ledge above -- when -- PING!-PING! -- BUL kick off the stones around him! He freezes, looks down at SOLDIERS standing guard ATOP THE FUEL TANKER RAILCARS -- of them lowers his rifle, yells out to Caesar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's high enough, kong! Caesar submissively holds up his hands. The soldiers eye a beat longer as Caesar returns to quarrying... then, coa clear, Caesar peers out at -- The ROCK OUTCROPPING in the distance, outside the camp; h can just make out a DARK FORM behind the boulders -- CUT

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR ON THE QUARRY LEDGE
dialogues.text: Caesar looking right at us, signing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [37 steps to the adult cage...   55 to the children.]

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL MAURICE
dialogues.text: lowering the binoculars; he ducks down behind the rocks - -- where the Girl and Bad Ape await his command. Maurice points to the Girl, then up at his eyes, looking around -- as if to say, "You, keep a look out." The Girl nods back very seriously, his little soldier.

dialogues.speaker: THE DUSTY COMPASS
dialogues.text: from the airstream trailer. The NEEDLE QUIVERS as the compass sits in a massive ape palm -- we are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice stares at the compass in his hand as Bad Ape watc holding the flashlight... finally, Maurice lifts his head and POINTS TO TWO DIFFERENT SPOTS ALONG THE TUNNEL WALL. Bad Ape nods eagerly, moves to one of the spots, and STAR TO DIG tentatively, looking to Maurice for approval; Maur nods, goes to the other spot, STARTS DIGGING as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At gunpoint, apes roll MASSIVE SOPHISTICATED ARTILLERY ou the depot at the base of the mountain, and along the trai tracks toward the barrier wall...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BARRIER WALL
dialogues.text: A cluster of POWERFUL GORILLAS struggle to hoist an impos high-tech RAPIER MISSILE LAUNCHER up to the top of the wa

dialogues.speaker: LAUNCHERS BEING POSITIONED BY APES AND SOLDIERS ALL ALONG
dialogues.text: EXPANSE. The display of sheer force is a formidable sight

dialogues.speaker: ON CAESAR
dialogues.text: as Red and Preacher march him across the yard amidst mass of weary apes being herded back to the pens; they arrive

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR'S CAGE
dialogues.text: As Preacher starts to unlock the door, Caesar's gaze shif to Red, and then to the ANGRY WELT over Red's eye where Rocket head-butted him; Red glowers, self-conscious. Preacher opens the door, and Red shoves Caesar in. Then R steps forward to remove the chain leash from Caesar's nec collar, pressing his face menacingly close to Caesar's: RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Kerna shoot apes tomorrow... when wall is done. Caesar's eyes shift briefly to Preacher's, who looks away Then he turns back to Red: CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wall is madness. It won't save him... any more than it will save you. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I save myself. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything left... of you to save? A brief flash of uncertainty passes over Red as he meets Caesar's piercing eyes... then he musters a final hard st at Caesar, and turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the rest of the apes are prodded off the wall, the intimidating fortification now complete; REVEAL --

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRL
dialogues.text: Watching from behind the rocks. She lowers the binoculars blinking out at the camp a beat...

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRL THROUGH THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Eyes wide, she searches for sign of Maurice or Bad Ape... She approaches the cement-filled impasse... finding TWO N DUG TUNNELS on either side of the blockage. She enters --

dialogues.speaker: ONE OF THE NEW TUNNELS
dialogues.text: She heads toward the distant glow of a flashlight up ahea Arriving behind Maurice, covered in dirt, still digging a He stops, noticing her. He looks at her quizzically -- points upward, makes a tentative thumbs up sign -- "everything ok up there?" She nods. He smiles: MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You are very brave.] She looks at him, confused.     He gently repeats the sig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Brave.] She hesitates, then slowly mimics him: THE GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [...Brave?] Maurice nods, proud; the Girl smiles, then signs uncertai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Ape?] Maurice doesn't understand -- she signs again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Me...?    Ape?] Maurice gets it now; stares back, struggling for an answe MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You are...] Then he notices something. He leans forward and reaches o gently lifting the Chevy NOVA emblem poking out of her ja pocket. He shows it to her, smiling warmly as he SPEAKS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at her) Nova. The Girl (now NOVA) takes the emblem back, staring at it it glints in her hand; she looks up at Maurice, pleased w her name -- when A GRUNT comes from behind; they turn -- BAD APE stands excitedly at the mouth of their tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come!   Come see! As Maurice and Nova move to join him... we LINGER a beat, PUSHING IN on the spot where Maurice was just digging... TINY RIVULET OF WATER begins seeping through the dirt...

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER NEWLY-DUG TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Bad Ape leads them forward as he WHISPERS, watching his f
He stops and proudly turns, holding out his hands: ta-da! Nova smiles mutely back at Bad Ape as Maurice looks up fr his compass, nods approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers, excited) What now? Maurice surveys the new tunnel, looking up at the ceiling then gets down on his hands and knees. He looks up at Bad Ape, and pats his own back, gesturing for Bad Ape to clim on. Bad Ape doesn't get it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. Maurice points up at the ceiling, then pats his own back again -- and now it dawns on Bad Ape:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh no. No no no... (looks to Nova) Noooo-- Shaking his head, Bad Ape starts to back away -- when Mau suddenly GRABS his ankle; Bad Ape goes silent, startled.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Maurice lets out a low, surprisingly MENACING GROWL... Ape takes a deep breath; then: BAD APE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: THE APE PEN
dialogues.text: The chained apes are being herded in. A SOLDIER stands inside the pen door, ushering them through, waving his ri CLOSE ON ONE OF THE SOLDIER'S BOOTS pressed into the ice dirt... when suddenly the TIPS OF APE FINGERS poke up fro tiny hole in the ground below, inches from the man's toes Oblivious to the presence of the boot, the fingers contin to widen the hole, clawing away at the earth... WE CUT --

dialogues.speaker: UNDERGROUND
dialogues.text: where Bad Ape stands with his hands above his head, his fingers reaching out through the hole. He stops digging f a moment, straining his neck to look up --

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE HOLE
dialogues.text: horrified to discover the Soldier's boot in front of his face! Bad Ape shrinks back -- when one of the apes amassi above NOTICES him, staring down into the hole, perplexed. Petrified, Bad Ape holds a finger to his lips -- The ape above suddenly gets it; he nods and holds out a h inconspicuously signalling Bad Ape to hang tight -- becom a look-out... as nearby apes start to notice Bad Ape too.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL MAURICE
dialogues.text: Bad Ape's feet shifting nervously on his shoulders; Mauri looks up uneasily, wondering what's taking so long...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BAD APE
dialogues.text: Eyes glued on the look-out ape, who still has his hand raised, watching some unseen activity above... Finally, h turns to Bad Ape again, NODS THE OK -- Bad Ape ventures up, PEERING anxiously through the hole t see THE SOLDIER'S BOOTS walking away, LEAVING THE PEN. On the Soldier's gone, he relaxes a bit, turning to see --

dialogues.speaker: APES GATHERED ALL AROUND HIM
dialogues.text: staring down into the hole with amazement... at the odd, coated ape in his toque -- a total stranger to them. Bad Ape smiles up at the crowd sheepishly -- when another roughly presses his way through to the edge of the hole - IT'S ROCKET. He stares down at Bad Ape, expressionless... and then a big smile spreads across his face. He turns excitedly to the look-out ape:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [This is the ape I told you about.] They all stare at him again, fascinated.       The look-o forward, and SIGNS to Bad Ape:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Thank you.] But Bad Ape looks up insecurely, not understanding the si seeing this, the look-out slowly reaches down into the ho OFFERING HIS HAND. Bad Ape regards the hand uncertainly... then CLASPS it, beaming. He stares up at his new friend, then pats his ch with his other hand, bowing his head as he nods, quietly fumbling for a way to introduce himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Bad Ape. (shaking other apes' hands) Bad Ape... Bad Ape... More and more apes jostle to get a look, greeting him war Bad Ape overcome by the affection from this new family.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN BELOW
dialogues.text: Maurice peers up at Bad Ape above him, trying to get a lo at what's going on -- when -- Nova tugs on his fur. He lo at her, and she points --

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: where a SMALL STREAM OF WATER is creeping toward them. Maurice looks at the ground beneath him as the water star to pool around his feet; alarmed, he instinctively steps forward to investigate -- forgetting Bad Ape on his shoulders. Bad Ape tumbles to the wet floor, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Maurice spins, realizing; Bad Ape looks at the water arou him, confused. As Maurice bends to help him, Bad Ape glan up, seeing something above -- Maurice follows his gaze to ROCKET peering over the edge of the hole with concern. eyes lock on Maurice's, immediately sensing trouble --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What's wrong?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar waits alone, staring     tensely at the apes acros way, all huddled around the     hole, backs to us. Rocket suddenly breaks through the     crowd to report to Caesar has been anxiously awaiting     news. Rocket looks grave:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [There's a problem.] As worry creeps into Caesar's face, we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUD AND WATER GUSH IN through a WIDENING FISSURE in the w where Maurice had been digging -- Maurice and Bad Ape try desperately to plug the opening with earth and rocks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear QUIET APE GRUNTING -- Caesar stands pressed to th bars of his cage looking across to a large group of apes gathered at the edge of their pen, all eyes fixed on Caes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apes in mid-debate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We can't dig any further, it will flood the whole tunnel!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [If we don't dig further, we'll never get to the children! How are we going to get them out?] A sudden swell of APE GRUNTS echo the sentiment -- Caesar raises a hand to quiet the apes, peering around at GUARDS PATROLLING THE CAMP to see if the noise alerted th

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rocket and some of the others glance up at THE GUARD TOWE directly above Caesar's cage... where Boyle is leaning suspiciously over the ledge. Boyle listens for a moment - then, hearing no more commotion, leans back. The apes all pause warily for a beat; then Lake signs stealthily, worried:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We have to keep looking down there, see if there's another way to reach the children...] But Caesar shakes his head, gravely serious:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We must leave tonight!] Pained, Caesar turns behind him, glances at the children, asleep in their pen -- he can see little Cornelius sleepi too -- he turns back to the other, decisive:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We'll have to get the children out above ground!] The apes exchange tense looks; then all look back at Caes

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMP
dialogues.text: The lights in the soldiers' barracks go out, one by one..

dialogues.speaker: UP BY THE GUARD TOWER OVER THE ADULT APE PEN
dialogues.text: Boyle steps slowly out onto the catwalk, quietly drinking from a steaming thermos, staring out into the distance -- WHEN SPLAT! He is SUDDENLY PELTED HARD in the back of his head with a handful of what looks like WET MUD from somew below. Stunned, he looks at himself, wiping the disgustin muck off: wtf?! He peers furiously over the railing at th pen below --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- you animals!

dialogues.speaker: BOYLE
dialogues.text: CHARGING down the tower ladder, heading for the pen! He thrusts his keys into the lock, slides open the door, and enters, shutting it behind him; he raises his gun at the shackled apes who shuffle fearfully out of his way: BOYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did that?! The apes cower, shaking their heads, protesting innocence when SPLAT! Another WAD of muck smacks the side of his he BOYLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: SONUVA--
dialogues.text: He spins, swinging his rifle -- the chained apes rush out the way in panic, parting to reveal -- THE CULPRIT. It's Rocket, who stands his ground as he gla back clutching another fistful of muck... Boyle recognize him: BOYLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... Livid, he raises his gun, about to shoot -- when an ORANG HAND SEIZES HIS ANKLE from below and YANKS HIM DOWN INTO HOLE IN THE GROUND! The Apes all stare at the hole... And a moment later, BOYLE'S KEYS are TOSSED BACK UP. Rocket moves forward and snatches them up. He looks down into the hole at Maurice; they share a determined look; t Maurice HANDS HIM UP Boyle's RIFLE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar urgently feels for something along the wall above cage door -- until he finds where he's hidden Preacher's He bends down and immediately begins unshackling his feet He gets one free -- when -- he hears FOOTSTEPS... He stop quickly turns, seeing -- THE FIGURE OF THE COLONEL approaching in the distance. Caesar straightens, carefully palming the key, eyes on th Colonel heading toward the pens... as Rocket, across the slowly hides Boyle's rifle behind his back...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But as the Colonel arrives, mysteriously he doesn't even glance at the apes, instead staring off at the finished w in the distance, lost in thought... He continues right pa them... stopping 20 paces away, back to us... He just sta there, motionless, taking the sight in. Caesar watches the Colonel anxiously -- when -- the Colon turns. He starts slowly back... heading to Caesar's cage. As he comes closer, we can see he is still in a fog. Caes is surprised to see the FLASK grasped absently in his han A strange silent beat. And finally, the Colonel speaks -- his tone is oddly vacant:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least you can take comfort... Your struggle ends... Ours goes on... Nature still has the power to wipe us off this planet at any moment... Killed the dinosaurs with a single meteor. He eerily studies Caesar's body... musing to himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You apes are so strong... I wonder... what kind of world you would have built... on our graves. Caesar's eyes search the Colonel's, trying to make sense his demeanor. The Colonel gazes off, as if lost in a drea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know when I first got to the city... a man said he had to see me. He said he knew you. That you worked together. Caesar looks surprised.    Beat.   Finally, warily:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Malcolm? Caesar's voice pulls the Colonel out of his reverie for a moment -- he looks at Caesar a bit confused; then, realiz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that was his name, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... was a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said you were remarkable.   More than just an animal...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you were a great leader. I thought he was crazy... But I almost see what he meant. (he drifts off again) He pleaded with me to find you. To make peace with you. Caesar is rapt, stunned by these revelations... But the Colonel is wholly unaware of Caesar's reaction, staring o in a long unnerving silence. Caesar hesitates, then: CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... happened to this man? The Colonel remains staring off a moment longer, then fin looks at Caesar... and then off again: THE COLONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shot him. He remains still a moment longer -- then suddenly looks around, disoriented, as if awakened from a dream -- THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly paranoid) What's going on here? Caesar frowns at him, disquieted and perplexed... The Colonel's eyes dart suspiciously around him; he cranes hi neck to peer up through the falling snow at the guard tow but the angle is too steep to see if anyone is up there - A CLANK at his feet makes him look down... where he finds he's dropped his flask. He picks it up, looks at it as if having no memory of even bringing it out here. Suddenly self-conscious, he looks around at the apes in t pen, all staring back at him -- and then at Caesar. He slowly backs away, then turns, retreating through the darkness to his tower. Caesar watches him go, then turns to find Rocket and the other apes looking at him, confused. ROCKET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [...What was that?] Caesar shakes his head, just as confused. Then returns to action, bending down to unshackle his other ankle -- he unlocks it -- then TOSSES PREACHER'S KEY TO -- ROCKET, who reaches through the pen bars and catches them air; he quickly unshackles himself, TOSSES THE KEY to --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LAKE, who immediately starts to unshackle herself -- she passes the keys down the line of her chain gang, they all begin to unshackle themselves too -- ROCKET moves to the pen door, uses BOYLE'S KEYS to unlock -- then tosses BOYLE'S KEYS across to -- CAESAR, who starts to unlock his cage -- when he notices something -- he holds up his hand! Everyone freezes. They all look up at --

dialogues.speaker: THE WARDEN'S TOWER
dialogues.text: to see the Colonel stepping toward his lighted window, hi face in SILHOUETTE -- he might be staring down at them, o off into the distance, it's impossible to tell... Caesar and Rocket share a tense look -- ROCKET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Do you think he knows we're up to something?] Unsure, Caesar peers back up at the Colonel's silhouette. After a beat, the Colonel steps away from the window. Roc looks anxiously at Caesar, raising the rifle:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Now?] CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) [Wait till he turns out his lights.] HOLD as they stare at the lighted window, waiting... waiting... SOUNDS OF FIERCELY GUSTING WIND rising... as w

dialogues.speaker: THE TOWER AND PENS
dialogues.text: IT'S SNOWING HARD NOW, a fresh layer blanketing everythin And still, the Colonel's lights remain on. The apes are a pressed to the bars of their pen, eyes fixed up on the Colonel's window; some pace, tortured by the wait...

dialogues.speaker: PUSHING IN ON CAESAR
dialogues.text: Staring up with coiled intensity, totally still... His ga shifts to Rocket, whose eyes are locked on Caesar -- ROCKET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The sun will be up soon...]

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Torn, Caesar steals a final look at the lighted window... then turns back to Rocket -- forced to make the call:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We go now. Or die trying.] Rocket nods -- he waits as the SEARCHLIGHT PASSES, then d out of the pen, holding the stolen rifle -- crossing to Caesar's cage, as Caesar steps out -- they both streak --

dialogues.speaker: TOWARD THE SOLDIERS' BARRACKS
dialogues.text: ducking into an alley between the building and the childr pen -- they press against the barrack's wall, peering dow the alley to see --

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS PASSING BY THE CHILDREN'S PEN
dialogues.text: Caesar waits until the Soldiers cross out of sight -- the looks to Rocket, and they head for --

dialogues.speaker: THE CHILDREN'S PEN
dialogues.text: A small cluster of kids rush to the door as Caesar unlock it; others stir from their sleep, scrambling over to see Caesar and Rocket enter. The little apes swarm around the wide-eyed. Caesar gently pats their heads, shushing them when suddenly he sees HIS SON in the crowd. Cornelius bre into a run, clambering up over the backs of the others... straight into Caesar's arms. Emotion floods Caesar's face he tightly embraces his son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overcome, holding him tight)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We glimpse the side of the Guard's head as he stares down eating -- REVEAL ROCKET, keeping lookout on the guard from the door behind him the children are huddled with Caesar -- Caesar hustles the children toward a LIGHT POLE, quickly hoistin one after another up onto it --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: where we see Caesar, Rocket and the children are on a sec story landing, dangerously close to the Guard Tower -- th little apes scale the tall light pole, scrambling out ont

dialogues.speaker: THE ELECTRICAL LINE
dialogues.text: suspended high over the Guard Towers and camp -- As SNOW SWIRLS HARD all around them, the children make th way back toward the adult pen -- directly over the heads the unwitting Soldiers below!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ADULT PEN
dialogues.text: The children arrive on the wire above and begin dropping silently, one by one -- into the waiting arms of Lake and other unchained apes -- the apes urgently hand the kids o to their anxious parents. As the emotional reunions continue, Caesar (Cornelius clinging around his neck) and Rocket finally arrive overh too, each dropping down into the grasp of the massive gorillas waiting below.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Staring up urgently from the hole in the adult pen... as Caesar and the apes converge above; Caesar and Rocket beg HANDING THE CHILDREN DOWN...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HOLE
dialogues.text: Maurice lowers the kids to the tunnel floor; they look up find Nova extending her hand... and they start off after down the tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Ape clutches himself, shivering nervously in the wind when he hears a NOISE FROM BELOW; he looks down to see -- Nova leading the apes out of the tunnel, and pointing the the ladder toward Bad Ape; he smiles sweetly, reaching do to the frightened children as he WHISPERS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok, little ones... come, come.

dialogues.speaker: THE EDGE OF THE OUTCROPPING
dialogues.text: Bad Ape pokes his head around a boulder, peeking up throu his BINOCULARS at --

dialogues.speaker: A GUARD POST ALONG THE BARRIER WALL
dialogues.text: where Soldiers pace, scanning the distant, dark horizon.. BAD APE turns behind him, where Maurice and Nova are now huddled with all the ape children -- Bad Ape gestures as

dialogues.speaker: WHISPERS
dialogues.text: BAD APE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!   Go go go...! Nova climbs onto Maurice's back, and they rush off, leadi the little apes SINGLE FILE from behind the rocks, dashin out across an EXPOSED STRETCH OF FLATS under the cover of darkness -- and heading up into the mountain on the side the camp...

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE ADULT PEN
dialogues.text: Caesar slowly moves toward the fence, staring out at something tensely, as behind him Rocket urgently ushers a down into the hole. As the last of the apes descend, Rock turns to see Caesar is staring up at the Warden's Tower. Rocket moves to Caesar, urgent -- ROCKET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Hurry!   Let's go!] But Caesar stays motionless, eyes fixed intently on the Colonel's still lighted window. ROCKET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Caesar, what's wrong?] Caesar stares darkly at the tower, preoccupied: CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time the sun rises, you'll all be on your way... to a new home. (finally, he turns) Hurry, you must go. And now it hits Rocket, Caesar is not coming with him -- ROCKET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Without you? No...]

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Caesar sees the pain in Rocket's face, and it pains him t but something still burns inside him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice was right. I am like Koba. He could not escape his hate... (his eyes fix on the tower again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I still cannot escape mine. He took too much from me. After a long moment, he turns back to Rocket; Rocket nods his eyes now unexpectedly emotional. Caesar puts a hand around Rocket's head, pulls his forehead against his -- a final embrace. He pulls back, says softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go... Rocket looks at him, then reluctantly starts for the hole He takes one last look at Caesar, and begins to descend.

dialogues.speaker: BAD APE
dialogues.text: excitedly waving on the children, sending them off toward mountain -- when an OMINOUS RUMBLING begins, shaking the ground. Alarmed, Bad Ape looks quickly up at --

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARD POST ALONG THE BARRIER WALL
dialogues.text: where Soldiers react to the sound, startled -- anxiously scanning the horizon -- suddenly SEEING something in the distance -- as --

dialogues.speaker: BAD APE
dialogues.text: TURNS to the horizon too, lifts his binoculars --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through snowy haze, we can make out the cock-eyed headlig of A HUGE ARMADA OF MILITARY VEHICLES APPROACHING INEXORA -- their hulking shapes advancing across the frozen tundr As ALARMS SOUND all along the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTS blink on in the windows as waking SOLDIERS flood i the yard with weapons -- we PAN WITH THEM as they RUSH fo the wall, SHOUTING -- SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit -- they're here!!! As they race by, the CAMERA FINDS CAESAR, hidden, crouche beside the building, watching them go, taking this news i He waits until the Soldiers pass, then BOLTS UP ONTO --

dialogues.speaker: THE BARRACKS ROOF
dialogues.text: We MOVE WITH CAESAR -- as he races along the edge, below we see the tide of Soldiers storming in the opposite direction... Finally, Caesar STOPS --

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE WARDEN'S TOWER
dialogues.text: He hears FRANTIC BANGING below.    He peers down to see - A GROUP OF OFFICERS POUNDING on the STEEL DOOR of the tow EXECUTIVE OFFICER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: (turns to one of the men)

dialogues.speaker: I CAN'T
dialogues.text: EXECUTIVE OFFICER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: WHERE THE HELL IS HE
dialogues.text: SOLDIER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL ALL NIGHT
dialogues.text: Caesar ducks back, quickly stares up at the tower overhea SPOTS the Colonel's OPEN WINDOW four stories above... He takes a last look around -- then LEAPS across from the barracks' roof to the side of the tower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More Soldiers rush past -- when one SLOWS, looking RIGHT US in utter shock. It's Preacher: PREACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAN with him as he steps right past the camera to REVEAL THE EMPTY APE PENS; he SPINS BACK to us, SHOUTING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
